Reviews.Title: “Good Starwood Option in Nice Istanbul Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: WrldTravlr14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and overall we were pleased with our experience. The hotel room was a little smaller than we expected, but well appointed and clean. As SPG Platinum members we were provided a complimentary continental breakfast, which was wonderful to have in the mornings. Had we been paying for breakfast though, I donâ€™t believe it would have been worth it. The food was good, but the selection was not that extensive. Plus, there is a great coffee shop (Kahve Dunyasi) out the door and to the left that had a more reasonable breakfast offering. There is also a grocery store to the left as well as a place to do laundry â€“ all within a few minute walk. These conveniences were great to have nearby. While the W is not located near the major tourist attractions, it is about a 15-20 minute walk from the nearest tram stop, which made it convenient for us to hop on and head into the city every morning. All in all, we were pleased and would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: amn511
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a bit out of the way from the bulk of the tourist attractions. The staff were excellent, friendly and attentive. Food and drinks were great if not a little on the pricey side. There are a few things that we noticed that were particularly overpriced, for example a hotel car to the airport was over 100EUR, on the way from the airport we go a private shuttle which was a car that dropped us at the hotel for 30EUR. If you are not worried about the cost this is a great place, if money is a bit tight you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “A specific value proposition”
Reviews.Author: WTBManila
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location, in a very interesting part of town not too far away from the main sights. The staff were attentive and nice. The food was only average. The style is unusual. The rooms are dark with little natural light the corridors long and dark with pink neon arches. It has a nightclub feel, and does boast a well known one to boot. Probably best suited to younger couples. (There is a functional gym). The beds were soft and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced and just not at the level they pretend to be ! Forget it.”
Reviews.Author: ggpublic
Reviews.Content: Spent here a night during the week-end after couple of days at le Meridien Etiler, another hotel from the Starwood galaxy. What a disappointment, why did I do that ? I paid 100 EUR more and got far less than what I had. There is not a single positive point for W Hotel from an end to end experience perspective ! (As said in another comment, why on earth Le Meridien is SPG 5 and W Hotel is SPG 6, I just can't understand. This should definitely be the reverse) The global "cool trendy chic" marketing positionning of the W hotels is fine, even if prices are high, as long as the whole customer experience is well managed and details are not forgotten. This is the least you can expect she paying 300+ EUR a room. And this is their weakness : they are just not at the level they pretend to be. Few bullet points : - Dark rooms - Poor amenities (very strict minimum with shampoo/showergel/conditionner for such a category, I never saw that anywhere else), - Furnitures not well maintained - POOR breakfast and POOR service (I mean, I can compare with where I was the day before in Instanbul, it is literally day and night) - No complimentary water in standard room (this is a joke, come on. At this price per night, not putting a 50 cts bottle of water is just a shame) - "Whatener whenever" concept does not worth it if you have to call back 60 min after ordering a meal in your room (supposed to be there at max 30 min after ordering) and you're being told that you have to wait an additional 15 min. OK, I finally did not pay for it. -...oh, and always surprised to see that, at check out, nobody is even asking you how was your stay. They don't understand anything in their business and just benefiting from the power of their brand. Disappointing! I'm living 50m away from the new W in Paris, I'll go there to understand if there is a difference. Blunt bottom line : forget about this hotel, out of the market.

Reviews.Title: “Service is a state of mind”
Reviews.Author: Liteworker
Reviews.Content: Trendy, yes, design is special, nice, warm, cozy, the room I stayed in was the Mega Room, but I wouldn't recommend it. It's much better to take the Spectacular room or the Fabulous room. The Mega room is bigger, but is at the end of a very very long hall. So every time you go to your room you really walk a long time and the most annoying, the staff elevator is just there, so from 7am there is a lot of noise of clapping doors and elevators and stuff being brought back and forth. And although being one of the more expensive rooms, I definitely would prefer the one with the terrace. I did like the lighting! it was a bit complicated to control, but once you got it...nice. The bed is very good as most SPG hotels. I was a bit amazed that even a Mega Room didn't have a bath. there is room for it, I get it that in standard rooms you only put a shower, but here? That would be a must for me. It is a bit strange to come in the door into your bathroom, but I an can see the smile on the interior designer's face when he pitched that idea to the client. It's a novelty, yes, but good "people centered" design...no! Service...yes service is a special thing. Either you have it, or you don't. They don't know yet. Our Airco was broken and I went at least 4 times to the front desk to ask to repair it...no such luck. it was either ice cold or hot warm whenever we came back from outside. When I mentioned that at checkout, first the guy on duty didn't say much, except for a smudge. But the duty manager stepped in, asked what was the problem, and gave me his card that next time I would come I should let him know, and he would provide free upgrade to compensate. I also told him about the noise, and he was sympathetic about it. But overall the staff is just not service orientated. For me that is a deeper problem that most of the time lies within the management of the hotel. If they don't install or nurture a philosophy of service mentality, then it will not come by itself. I have been 3 times at the W, mostly because of its location, but never saw an improvement. Maybe these reviews will help it !

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, no attention to details... is this really a W?”
Reviews.Author: Camille d
Reviews.Content: I'm a SPG, I stay every month in W hotels across the US for business (Seattle, Chicago, LA Hollywood, LA Westwood, Miami Beach...) and had to stay in W hotel in Istanbul for a personal trip. My overall experience was very disapointing and I would recommend any regular W hotel goer, NOT TO GO to the W Istanbul. Besides its very good location, the overall service standard is very poor: - I had a problem with my booking which didn't work and I had to stay my first night in another Starwood hotel. The concierge didn't care, showed no empathy, offered no alternative option. He basically didn't do anything to help. He let me seat in the lobby without offering me any refreshment or service eventhough I was obviously coming a long way and tired. - You meet staffs in corridor throughout the hotel, you never get a hello, never receive a smile, basically you don't feel welcomed at all. - I went to the "spa" for a massage. The "spa" is this dark, old room, with damaged paint and minimum facility, no changing room, no shower....basically a gloomy closet. - When you ask for direction in the hotel (the hotel is a maze), no staff ever knew what i was looking for was. The staffs have no idea of where amenities are located in the building. - The so-called "Whenever, Whatever" was a joke. I asked for the host to get me some tickets for an event in town, he basically told me where i could go and buy those tickets and ignored me. Wasn't he the one supposed to go above and beyond and get those tickets himself, or send someone? I would have paid for that service. - I paid for a suite which i thought would be a nice upgrade vs a traditional single king room. The room was dark as the building is a lowrise and there is no real bathroom! The bathroom basically is in your entry, in separate elements, which gives you no sense of privacy or cozyness whatsoever. Overall, besides its great location, the W hotel isn't a place worth staying in. There are staffs who don't understand what to do, what their job is and what service means. It was a very poor experience and I will never go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Very Good”
Reviews.Author: JoseVargas100
Reviews.Content: W hotels are not for everyone, and some are better than others. I have stayed in several and the W Istanbul was neither my favorite nor my least favorite. The design of the hotel is nice, very modern, set in an older building outside of the tourist area. The tram is a 15 minute walk and will take you right to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. There is a nice grocery store about a block away, as well as a laundry place about another block up the same street (walk outside the hotel, go hard left, both will be on your right). I found the service a bit cool compared to the Westins and Le Meridiens I usually stay at, and even some Ws. The room we had was also a bit strange, as others have noted, with the shower and toilet directly off the room. It's hard to describe and I had never seen anything like it. Not terrible, but different. I would probably give my experience a 3+ if that existed; it was better than good, but overall not great. So let's call it Almost Very Good. I would stay here again, although now that there is a Le Meridien open in Istanbul, I would probably try that first. If you are a W fan, however, give this one a shot. As a final note, the on-site restaurant is quite good and fairly moderately priced... worth a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Not Terribly Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Wooglin46
Reviews.Content: I'm a platinum Starwood guest so I love SPG and tend to stay only in Starwood properties worldwide. I think next time I am in Istanbul, I'll switch to Le Meridien or Sheraton. The W is fine... conveniently located and trendy like a W generally tends to be. In fact, I stayed in a different W the following evenings in a different city and had a great experience. However, I found the Istanbul to be very trendy, but not particularly warm or comfortable. The staff was difficult to approach, solemn, and did not welcome my questions with a 'warmth' or genuine concern. They automatically add a Unicef $1 donation to your bill at check-out without addressing it, which I found shady - I would be happy to donate $1, but ask me before you add it to my bill. The elevator would park on my floor, which would mean I would hear the song it was playing... at 4am nightly... and it was quite loud. The breakfast buffet is good, but 60TL and there was an unwillingness to make the custom items such as omelettes and french toast, which are overtly advertised as you walk in. Decent gym in a small space. All in all... a trendy hotel where if you feel cool by staying at a W, it might meet this expectation. But if you are also looking for customer service and a welcoming stay, I might recommend trying a different Starwood property or even the Hilton. I stayed there last time as the W was above my company's limit... and it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Average overall”
Reviews.Author: MMoran
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel from the outside but inside it's so dark! They are just trying to hard to be very trendy and cool and I think it just comes across as being irritating. The rooms are all dark wood and are very average although they try to cover this up with little extras. They have ipod jacks in the rooms for charging which I find very handy and the beds are very comfortable but at this stage the rooms could do with a little renovating. You also must be a fan of pink! There's pink lighting everywhere! Three other little points; 1. They try to sell W merchandise to you in your room. 2. The concierge's outside are more interested in chatting to themselves rather than help you get a taxi and 3. The room service food is not of the quality I have come to expect in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “march 26”
Reviews.Author: giovani f
Reviews.Content: strange set up...very claustrophobic rooms close to everywhere. staff nice Laounge good

Reviews.Title: “Hip place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: karsiyakali_eatl
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights with my wife...The desing is the plus side of the hotel, it is famous with its design so I can not argue with it, it is chic and very hip. Everyone working in the hotel were really professional and helpful. The room has very high ceiling which is a big plus for me, because it adds a perception of spacious area even to the smaller places such as shower. Hence there were 4 or 5 preset lighting options you can choose from, however none of them were good enough for me to shave or for my wife to for makeup. To create a romantic athmosphere I can understand little usage of light but I'd be happy by having an option for a well illuminated room. We had a breakfast on Sunday and it wasn't any special for me, lower than my expectations from W Hotel. And the price for the breakfast was 60 TL which is pretty highy, considering it will take only 5-10mins to reach Ortakoy where different choices such as House Cafe or Kitchenette can offer better breakfast for the same amount or lower. It is very hip place to stay and especially if you are coming from abroad, it is close to many attaractions (Dolmabahce Palace is across the road, Ciragan Palace, Ortakoy, Bebek and even historical peninsula is not far away). I would recommend for anybody wants to stay in a very hip hotel and good location in European side, but I can say it is an expensive option. And I do not recommend to have breakfast at the hotel, in stead try different places in Ortakoy and Bebek.

Reviews.Title: “Puts design before function sometimes - ok if "hip" is what you look for”
Reviews.Author: fromFehmarn
Reviews.Content: Like it's W brethren in the Starwood chain, this hotel also desperately tries to be hip. So get out of the suit and put on your black turtleneck and the branded garb and mix with the hipsters. The rooms are small and tend to be dark - I chose a "Fabulous" category room with it's own "private terrace" - this turned out to be a 4th floor room with low ceilings and a rather small balcony seating two. The bathroom is spacious and well equipped. The rest of the room so-so. Hiding the TV behind smoked glass may be a nice design gag, but of course the picture quality suffers. Smallish desk with a chair that had a mind of its own, one lounger and not much room around. Functional. Not more. The bed was very nice, firm with good pillows. An iPhone dock along with a Bose wave radio completely fulfill my expectations. Good internet speed at 30tl (12 Euro) per day but the minibar is outrageously priced. Beware of deafening noise from the hotel's bar on Thursday nights - the closer you are (lower numbers) to the bar, the worse it gets.I could actually feel the bass in bed. I did try the restaurant for lunch, no complaints, but the real action starts a few feet away from the hotel in bustling Besiktas. Take a walk, out the door turn left, then next right, and there are bustling streets and an abundance of little restaurants beckons within sight of the fish market. Breakfast at 60 TL (25 Euro) was a let-down. Getting the staff to bring a cup of coffee is not easy, and two eggs on toast, sunny side up, arrived as two rock hard eggs which had been sitting in a chafer for what must have been hours. No toast, either. A request for two freshly made eggs resulted in a discussion with the waitress - but did ultimately reap the desired dish. Still without toast. Multiple request for butter or margarine yielded no result. Would I return? I guess not. The novelty wears off fast and the shortcomings by far outweigh the hipness factor. Add to that rather high prices and you are left with many more choices in that fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but strange”
Reviews.Author: mtd23
Reviews.Content: Our least favorite place in Turkey. The place was modern, but trying too hard to be something its not. The reception was a bit over the top, wanting to know our exact plans while we were in the city. Our room was one large room, no separate bathroom. The room basically had a small closet that was converted into a toilet room, another small closet made into a shower, and the sink/countertop in the bedroom. Very peculiar. Location is also far from the main attractions, need to taxi everywhere and really nothing is within walking distance, which is very different from other parts of Istanbul. There is some limited shopping, but not enough to keep you busy for more than an hour or so.

Reviews.Title: “Great design hotel”
Reviews.Author: kschoena
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located only 5 minutes walk from the water. Ideal if you need to take a vapur to cross the Bosphorus. Tram 1 is only 15 minutes walk away. This tramline brings you directly into the center of old Istanbul for less than 1 euro. The hotel is very trendy (like all W hotels) with very cool rooms. The staff is super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular, Chic & Eclectic”
Reviews.Author: harnid
Reviews.Content: Spectacular, Chic & Eclectic... these 3 words aptly describe the W Istanbul. Its Edgy Decor is evident as soon as you enter the premise. The entire Hotel is laced with Dazzling Pinks & Purples, which might be loud for some but was refreshing for me. W provides a very different Hotel Experience. It has everything that your typical 5 Star would have but yet its extremely different. The Rooms are excellent too, especially the ones with the Cabana or the Terrace. The only thing they lack is a Bath Tub, otherwise they are full of modern gadgets & excellent amenities. The Suites offer a small balcony with a gorgeous view of the by-lanes. The W lounge is the best Night Club & defines the Night Life in Istanbul. Okka Restaurant serves awesome food but the service is a bit slow. They don't have a pool in the premise but offer free usage of the Pool at Suada Club (Imagine a Pool between 2 Continents in the Bosphorus). They have an excellent Business Center slightly away from the main building. The Hotel is located in a very Chic neighborhood which has excellent cafes & restaurants in its vicinity. Its walking distance from the Besiktas Market. Its away from the Old City but very close to Takshim / Istiklal Street & the Kabatas Pier & Tram Station. I truly enjoyed the W Experience & would definitely recommend it to Istanbul Travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, reliably "W"”
Reviews.Author: clickonline
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was away from the historic sites of Istanbul. Taksim Square and Sultanahmet are a short taxi ride away. The hotel is in a neighborhood with a lot of character. The rooms are classy and unique. I have stayed in several different types of rooms and the suites are amazing! The decor is consistent with local history making the experience even more amazing. I will highly recommend the hotel for couples looking to get away from the crowds and spend sometime in a romantic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too hip for its own good”
Reviews.Author: Michael P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a nice neighborhood and was very flashy. The bar seemed very hip, and the decor is all very modern. If you're single and traveling on business (i.e. someone else is paying), this might be a good place. Otherwise, it's a joke. The bottom line: the design of the hotel was its downfall. The service wasn't perfect, but it was not the reason we will never stay at a W hotel anywhere again. Here's the list of bad stuff: 1. The elevator was at the back of the building and we had to follow a maze past doors for "Talent Only" to find it. 2. We had to call the front desk to figure out how to turn the lights on. Really?! 3. Light switches are in stupid places, like behind doors or next to the bed. I shouldn't have to cross the room to turn on overhead lights when I first come in the door. 4. The bathroom lights are horrible for doing makeup or shaving. 5. The shower also required a call to the front desk. 6. The cold water in the sink came out piping hot. After they came to fix it, it still came out hot and we were told to "let it run for 5 or 10 minutes until it comes out cold". Really?! This is in a country where water is in limited supply?! 7. The baby crib that was brought up for us was a cheap plastic folding thingie with no crib mattress. Our baby was miserable the whole trip until we finally figured out the problem and had her nap on the king bed the last day. 8. The restaurant features a breakfast buffet for 60 Turkish Lira per person, not included in room rate. Way too expensive. 9. We ordered off the (slightly) cheaper menu and found the food average at best, but with tiny, wannabe gourmet servings. 10. Service was slow, whether we were alone in the restaurant or among many other customers. 11. We asked for a high chair for our baby. While we waited, they took our drink orders. While my wife was standing around bouncing the baby, waiting for 10 minutes for the high chair, the staff wandered around the room and then brought us our drinks. And asked if we were ready to order. Still no baby seat! Really?! 12. Our final morning, we ordered the pancakes after overhearing another guest rave about them. One serving consists of two (2) coaster-size pancakes that tasted average at best, with two (2) sliced strawberries and half a banana, sliced. Plus a tablespoon of maple syrup. So chic, so modern, so gourmet. So average and overpriced, it was even more annoying that they didn't bring my wife her syrup and I didn't have enough for both of us. Then it took 15 minutes before I could flag a waiter down to bring her some. Really?! 13. I sipped coffee one morning in the downstairs lounge. The chairs are very modern, but totally uncomfortable, which pretty much encapsulates our whole experience with the hotel. I'll be honest. We had a great time in Istanbul and I love Turkish people (partly because they were effusively affectionate toward my baby). The sights were great. The location of the hotel is a bit out the way for the major downtown historic sites, but it wasn't difficult getting around on public transportation. But the W Istanbul was a major downer. Every day we'd moan, "Oh no! Do we have to go back to the hotel again?!" On a positive note, the concierge provided lots of helpful information on sites and options for first-time tourists like us.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, charmingly chick place in an eternal city”
Reviews.Author: lyskupi
Reviews.Content: I love Istanbul and all about this city, W hotel just adds to this experience. Innovative concept of hotels with unique design stories , loved it. Staff (talents as they are called) friendliness makes you feel more special. Will go again...

Reviews.Title: “Unique”
Reviews.Author: Jmims
Reviews.Content: My experience here (overall) was pretty positive. The room was comfy, the people were friendly, the bath products were great... I loved the funky decor. We tried one of the restaurants (forgot the name but it had an elephant theme) and it was pretty good. Breakfast had a huge selection. My only complaint was that when we arrived, the cabana (we booked the marvelous room and these have private cabanas) was still covered in tarp, which I guess they keep so as to protect the furniture when it rains, etc. When we asked someone if they could get the tarps removed, the guy initially said that during the colder months they kept the cabanas covered. Maybe the guy just didn't know what he was talking about (he actually wasn't someone at the front desk) , but THE MAIN reason to book this room is for the private cabana, and it was only October. not balmy, but definitely not that cold out. Anyway he eventually called to find out and got someone to come and remove the tarp. We enjoyed hanging out on the cabana. I'd say this was a fun place to try out. I wouldn't say it's the best value for money, but it's unique and fun and worth a try. Also it was interesting to stay in this area and explore the different neighborhoods along the Bosphorus... though maybe it's not the ideal location for someone visiting for the first time with a limited amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel - Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: JJM81
Reviews.Content: Very unique, modern rooms and friendly staff! The free wireless in the lobby was nice. This hotel had all the amenities that I love about the W chain but felt like a smaller, boutique hotel. I was very comfortable here and didn't want to leave! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, funky, loud, cool, the W Rocks”
Reviews.Author: UKBoyDKGirl
Reviews.Content: Moody lighting, Armani clad staff, purple designer chairs, great bar, sexy rooms, good food and even a decent garden just for me. Thankfully my room was very far from the bar as on one night the Dj's were spinning some banging tunes which do reverberate around the corridors. My local friends were wowed by the Absolut sponsored modelling agency party that you dont normally get in hotel bars when you're on business. They're going back. Roof terrace good with its own bar, uber trendy crowd are friendly and party late. Rock star stuff but not for shrinking violets or serious business types. Good location with the whole area recently refurbished and full of top level designer shops and good local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel . Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mobashir
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 6 nights with SPG points. The staff is super friendly, the room is cozy but small (This is where i took off one star). Other then that no complains. We took the ferry from besiktas to Eminonu and Kadokoy(Asian) side every day ( a 3 minute walk from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great, swanky hotel in a good area”
Reviews.Author: KitweTraveller
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my experience at the W. The rooms are a bit swanky with lots of mood lighting and the like, but large and well equipped (e.g. with some cool things like iPod docks so that you can play your favorite music). The fitness center is small but in good condition with cardio and strength training equipment. Breakfast is ok, but expensive (over EUR 20 for the buffet which is expensive for Istanbul). Location is excellent: lots of restaurants in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Great room!”
Reviews.Author: dYquem
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great (much more low-key than your average W). The staff were very attentive and helpful on check-in. They were willing to deliver room service off the main menu even after hours. The room was spacious and well-furnished. My bed was incredibly comofrtable. It was easy to get a taxi in the morning. It's the third time I've stayed here and will definitely come back. SPG Platinum customers get quite a good room upgrade if there's availability. 5/5 easy.

Reviews.Title: “The most boutique W I've been to but nice”
Reviews.Author: James t
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend (now wife) stayed here for four nights in the summer. The location is great, the rooms are really well done. It's the smallest W I've ever stayed at but it had everything you could need and the location was perfect. The breakfast in the hotel was pretty good but room service pretty poor, but what I've come to expect from W hotels really. But all in all we weren't disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “W all the way - happy stay”
Reviews.Author: Mustihaveone
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights, booking 2 rooms for me and a friend. As a platinum guest, we were upgraded to two really large and nice rooms - 354 and 356. The hotel is in a nice, low-rise building and it is a less-than-10TL ride from Taksim Square if you take the Havatas there, and the taxi back to Ataturk airport cost 50TL on the meter. The room was excellent - large, heavenly bed, a daybed against one of the large windows, a nice TV and a great bathroom area with two sinks, shower and the toilet. There was no bathtub which is fine with me, as I do not like wallowing in my own filth, to quote Kramer. Service from the get go was excellent but it could have been exceptional if they had done one more thing - one of our taxi drivers was trying to gyp us for a ridiculous amount (TL35 from Sultanahmet) and we knew it could not be more than TL15. The hotel guy came, looked at us, looked at the driver and then left us to our own devices. Ideally, I would like them to treat us as one of their own and protect us from these a##hole taxi drivers. The breakfast was very good - not cheap at TL60, but very good with interesting cheeses, spreads and what not. You even have a view of the Bosphorus from the breakfast lounge. Positives: characterful hotel, well done decor-wise, classic W ambience, nice neighborhood with a few cafes and an older quarter with local eateries a bit further up the hill, great service, great breakfast Negatives: Location: not close to Sultanahmet and other "typical tourist" places, but if you are a repeat visitor like me or a business visitor, this may suit you fine; likewise, there are limited dining options close to the hotel. Although I was far from the W's club/lounge, I could hear thumping music at night from I think a different club on the ground floor, next to the Cafe Nero.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: joannesim77
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Istanbul and we've always loved the W brand for hotels. We picked W hotel Istanbul for we've heard good reviews about the place. Getting to the hotel from the airport was relatively painless for we followed the directions listed on the site. The hotel was hip and true to the W brand name that's been built internationally. The room was clean and well-equipped with all the Bliss products that we've been used to having in most of the W hotels around the world. We also loved the gym for it allowed us to maintain some form of exercise regime during our stay there. Public transportation around the hotel is pretty limited so we relied mostly on taxis when we went out in the evenings. Otherwise, there are neat bars/restaurants around the hotel that you could check out.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: businesstravel680
Reviews.Content: this hotel is nice & fashionable, AND is also super quiet with extremely helpful staff. everything about it is great. love the showers. the beds are SO comfortable. after a long flight or a long work day, it is so nice to have the comforts of this excellent hotel. can't say enough nice things about it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: batex
Reviews.Content: It was one of the best hotels I've stayed in, lovely rooms, great service and it has a wonderful Asian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy stay”
Reviews.Author: bergen32
Reviews.Content: Great place for couples and those that love modern and swanky. Didn't have the space and amenities of luxury hotels in the same price point, but cool atmosphere and expected great service. Safe location, but we took a cab to most places... soooo much traffic. We requested a room with a balcony....must do! Offers a little more space and great place to enjoy room service breakfast. We didn't have a view, but enjoyed the outdoor private space. Love the choice of lighting (watch, work, romantic, etc) and other little details. Most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Complementary apple tea in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel with a Very Odd Floorplan & Even Odder Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bukovitz
Reviews.Content: This is a very strange Starwood hotel, but not all bad-strange. The floorplan is unique, to say the least; and the rooms are not what you will see anywhere else in a W-chain hotel. I didn't particularly care for some features of my room, such as the dark purple colors and black velvet decor, but I like experiencing different styles and this style was a mix between post-modern and ecclectic and "man, I think someone slipped LSD into my drink". The lighting was very poor in the bathroom and not great anywhere in the room, but the shower - - like many Turkish showers - - was massive and awesome. It was not a Turkish hammam (Turkish bath), but the size was similar to some small hammans. It's the type of room where it will take you 15 minutes to figure out how to operate the electrically-operated blinds, recessesed lighting, etc. I would not recommend a long stay here, but for one of two nights, it was cool. My hypothesis is that the hotel and room designers tried too hard on this one to be "modern", or were smoking some excellent Turkish Red Afghani while making some of the final design choices. The end-result is not my taste, but I do appreciate the effort to escape the mundane and be different. I'm not entirely sure I would go back to the W Istanbul, but don't regret staying; sort of a "been there, done that" response to this hotel. This said, I would highly recommend this hotel to any Grateful Dead music fans, because there is something about old Deadheads which would appreciate some of the faux pas design glitches in this hotel without being judgemental. The only thing missing from my room was a 1960's glow lamp and a blacklight. Thirty years ago . . . my wife would have really enjoyed getting high here, and probably would have ended up in a Turkish Prison. Thank God those days are long past! The restaurants in the hotel, like most upscale hotels, are expensive and not the value that can be had compared to what you can get elsewhere in Istanbul. This said, the small street-level restaurant had some of the best lamb I have had in Turkey, and that is saying something. The staff here here is very friendly and anxious to help. The English skills of all of the staff I spoke with were also very good, but good English is not difficult to come by in educated Turks, especially in the hospitality industry. I would rate the concierge service here as considerably above the norm in Turkey, and amongst the best I have experienced in the W-chain. The staff manning the concierge desk really knows the city in all its facets, and Istanbul is a complex city. All-in-all . . . a very different experience, mostly positive, but not a place I would like to be stuck in the room all day doing business.

Reviews.Title: “A litle of centre but a very trendy and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulus70
Reviews.Content: Excelent room, modern decoration , the service not so good, excelent bar ful of life around midnight. The location isn't the best because of the trafic. If you go sightseing or shoping it may be a problem to go to your room during the day .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel that tries too hard to be stylishly different”
Reviews.Author: LondonTelegramSam
Reviews.Content: More than most W hotels (and that is saying something!), this one tries to be too stylish and the result is probably an either you love it or you hate it reaction from guests who stay there. I personally did not like it - it is too dark, everyhting is black and dark purple, add to that some of the narrow corridors and oddly shaped rooms and the result is not a success. But the quality is good - rooms, beds, bathrooms, amenities, staff, food are all above average. It is also in a good area, it is new so that always makes it more agreeable than a hotel that needs maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: tennista1961
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights this autumn and I was not impressed at all, specially bearing in mind the cost of a standard room (abt 320 Euros per night with no breakfast). i did some research, unfortunately afterwards, and there are other cheaper options in hotels of the same category in the same area. The room itself was rather dull and I was not impressed with the public areas either. I did niot find the staff either friendly or helpful. I enjoyed my stay in Istanbul and I would like to go back some day, but I will certainly choose another hotel

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ANSQ8
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel when I visited Istanbul because I heard good things about its unique architecture and design. The hotel is suitable for families, friends, and couples. I ll start off with listing the good points: +The staff was very friendly and helpful, they upgraded my room with out extra charge. They also gave us very good recommendations in restaurants and attractions. +The food in the hotel was excellent, and the breakfast buffet felt warm and homey. +The location was great, close to the museums and attractions and in the same time not on a major road, so it was quite and safe. Not so good points: - Although the design of the hotel was very unique and beautiful, I thought the ceiling was too low and the rooms were too small.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, even for a family and young kids”
Reviews.Author: mytravels4u
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel in November, 2011. Was traveling with my wife and kids. The location of this hotel is really nice - in Besiktas. The entire staff was extremely nice and helpful, from the gents at the door, the front desk, housekeeping and the folks at the restaurant at breakfast time. When we first checked in, they had two rooms for us, however that night there was a party going on in the club area on the 1st floor. As soon as we got to our rooms on the 3rd floor, we could hear the sounds from the club and I went straight back down to the front desk and asked them to change our rooms. They were very accomodating and changed the rooms (to be down the hall) immediately. The next day, they even upgraded me to a larger room. I was happy with the room and we had plenty of space. Breakfast is nice and expensive, but was included in my room rate - which was nice. The staff was very nice and the food not bad at all. Turkish tea is a must have. The location is great. Very close to the KabataÅŸ tram station (can catch the train to all the touristy areas) and the DolmabahÃ§e palace. Also close to OrtakÃ¶y (nice market and views of the Bosphorus from there). Definitely a hotel I would go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mannyb02
Reviews.Content: Was there on business but this hotel made me feel right at home. Nicely located a few blocks away from the nicest shopping district in town. Good restaurants at walking distance. Believe me, when you see traffic in Istanbul, you'll be happy you can walk for food or shopping. The room was spacious with all the commodities, service was excellent...absolutely no complaint.

Reviews.Title: “expensive and unique”
Reviews.Author: canertekin
Reviews.Content: a different experience very nice hotel. excellent location. give it a shot

Reviews.Title: “Not so Comedy of Errors”
Reviews.Author: asrightasrain
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish hotel that is well located in a nice section of the city. It is close to many of the sights and night life of Istanbul. Somehow, I have just been having a challenging stay. My first room was 232. On check in, I noticed that the room was cold and called after an hour to see what could be done heat it better. They said that the room unoccupied for a while and that they could centrally heat it faster. Even after 16 hours in the morning the room was still only 17 deg C. I probably could have slept longer, but the room was immediately beside the storage for housekeeping. After that door slammed shut for the 30th time, I just got up and showered and got ready to move. Cautionary advice: the Mega Rooms are at the end of the halls and will have this issue. Currently, I am awake to the pulsations of the hotel night club in room 304, my suite upgrade. It is a fantastic room, except that the vibrations of the club are pulsing through the floor. I probably should have just stayed in the cold room. At least, I could sleep until morning. In both cases, the noise is not something that earplugs can help. It is a vibrating of the walls, floor and bed. Cautionary advice: do not go for a low numbered room. This still leaves lots of beautiful ones available to you. I tried having a drink at the bar at Minyon. However, the staff kept reaching across my small snack, glass and iPhone to retrieve glasses, put back dirty items. So, I just gave up and went up to just chill and get ready for bed and another touring day tomorrow. Additionally, the safe in the room was not fixed during the day as promised. After we got clear that was not Mr. Morrison and that the meeting point was actually at the room not the lobby as I was told, the guys fixed every thing quickly. The other challenge with this hotel is the price to value of the additional services. The airport driver fee is 125 â‚¬. A movie from the entertainment system 30Â£. (I can not explain the different currencies). These seem out of order to the price of the room. I recently stayed at the W in Bali and New York with much better value for the extras. On the positive again, the staff here are extremely helpful and very nice people. The concierge hooked me up with a great driver for the day. He knew some great spots for photos that were less well trodden by throngs of tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Boutique Hotel - but let down by small things”
Reviews.Author: DesandLorraine
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a three night stay at the W Istanbul. First of all the good things. The location is great, the rooms are stylish and the concierge is brilliant. The hotel is very like the Morgan hotels, quite dark and stylish, lots of mood lighting and comes across very trendy. However the food is very poor, both room service and the restaurant. Breakfast is overpriced, cold and very limited. Theres no free wifi and no baths only showers. A nice place to visit for a short time but needs to sort out a few basics to be worthy of the W tatus

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: The W Istanbul is an outstanding hotel. I've stayed there twice. My room was huge and stylish. They used to have a lot of shops around the hotel but they're all closed now which is a pity. My only complaint is that the quality of the restaurant is not up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: LBOskiBear
Reviews.Content: If you are a devotee of the W hotel chain, I'm sure you will like this. However, it's not really to my liking. The hotel is located in an OK neighborhood but is not near a metro station - a bit of a walk. Rooms are nice but dark - typical of a W. The breakfast was also typically overpriced - $30US for a very average buffet that I was afraid to eat as nothing was refrigerated. All the food was just left out and sitting at room temperature - including the tepid coffee.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bader R
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world and stayed in some of the best hotels but the W Istanbul is my favorite hotel now. The stay was perfect from beginning till end. I am 37 years old man who was traveling alone and stayed 5 nights at the hotel beginning of this month. The hotel rooms and facilities are just perfect with a very hip and trendy decoration. The check in by the young man Serhat at reception was literally 50 seconds. No kidding, it was so quick i was just like wow. All the staff were amazing specially Hasan and Jim the concierge guys, the two men at breakfast every morning, and the cleaned shaved guy with white hair who was always there when I needed him ( sorry i cant remember your name) I just want to say that if you are going to Istanbul stay in this hotel and you will not regret it. And big thanks to every one at the W for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel, good location but ask for room away from club”
Reviews.Author: bellissima66
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W in Istanbul for 4 nights for business. My room was large and funky. The service was good as was the breakfast. I liked the location as you could walk to restaurants, coffee etc. The 2 negatives were: room are kind of dark even if you turn on every light and my room was on the 2nd floor closest to the club and 2 of the 4 nights (Saturday and the night of a cool Ferrari party) there was such loud noise and vibrations that even with ear plugs in, I could hear the bass. Otherwise I think it's a good choice for W.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J-LA33
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a heard W properties in general were a sight to see, and I heard right! W Istanbul was a great experience! Rooms are great, spacious and unique; very different then what I have seen in my previous travels. Upon check-in our rooms were not ready as we arrived early, so we sat in the lounge with a drink that was provided by the hotel. The hotel manager (cant remember his name, but he was originally from Vancouver) introduced himself, asked us how long long we were here for and recommended some great places. I had a problem with my hair staigther when i used the hotel adapter, which ended up being fried and although they were not able to replace, they did offer some good will SPG points which was a nice touch, as I am a gold member. Overall: if you are in Istanbul, I would highly recommend this place, and W properties in general. My only negative is, and it is not against the hotel that I would like them to open one up in Manilla or Delhi (specifically Gurgoan) as I travel there alot for business.

Reviews.Title: “Very cmfortable, needs a little fine tuning”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at W on our first night in Istanbul and really enjoyed the location and the room. The service was very pleasant and friendly. The beds were VERY comfortable. It should be noted that the arrangement of the bathroom in the room is not built for privacy. If you are travelling with just a friend, the shower opens directly into the room and there are no walls seperating the bathroom area from the bedroom area. We managed just fine, but would have preferred some privacy. Our one service hiccup came with the concierge, who made a poor reccomendation and reservation for a restaurant for dinner. We were dressed very casually and did not want to dress for dinner after a day of travelling. We asked for a recomendation for a restaurant that our dress code would not be an issue. (But wanted to sit for a nice meal, steak, wine, etc.) She sent us to a very upscale and expensive seafood restaurant which would have been lovely had we been dressed appropriately. Luckily, after leaving after our appetizer, we chose to walk back to the hotel and wandered into a terrific neighborhood where we found more of what we were looking for. The hotel also provided an ammenity (being Starwood Preferred Guests) and then proceeded to charge us for the ammenity. This is a comfortable place, but not any kind of authentic Turkish experience and similar to W's everywhere. Breakfast and airport transfers are not included.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: WorldCap
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night during a business trip stopover. Great restaurant around the hotel. Concierge was very knowledgeable and provide ample of good advice. Location is not so great even though it seems to be located in a posh neighbourhood. Travelling to where the centre of attractions require taxi ride and will undoubtedly get you into the traffic jam. Nonetheless, the hotel alone is still of high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near yet far”
Reviews.Author: richardpeace
Reviews.Content: First time here in Istanbul and the w is a great choice very welcoming staff and knowledgable .everything is a short taxi hop away from the crowds .rooms on the small side however compact and clean good gym never saw anyone else in there during my stay.didn't t eat in the hotel but staff recommended some good choices .hotel bar great good music over the weekend. Will for sure return.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star hotel with tiny rooms, no sauna, no swimming pool and no turkish bath.”
Reviews.Author: quatranu
Reviews.Content: As frequent user of these 5 star hotels, I was really surprised to see at such an expensive rate of 220 euros an hotel with tiny rooms, no sauna, no swimming pool and no turkish bath. Breakfast was not included and the iPhone connection for the room music was requiring maintanance. Of course the location is good and the service is cool. But the price unfortunately for this tiny W in istambul is not consistant, as other w hotels in the world (ie Hong Kong W with a swimming pool on floor 76)

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: Travel_bum99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a in a great location near lots of night life, also has a good bar/ club in it and a friendly helpful hotel staff, and a nice workout facility. The rooms are so so, they are decorated very stylishly but functionally lack a little bit. We found, and other guests shared that unless you are on the top floor that the rooms have a cave like feeling with dark interior and a lack of natural light. The bathroom is merged with the bedroom area (in a basic room) so privacy is sort of at a minimum if getting ready with someone else in the room. The arrangement of lights around the room is difficult to turn off, especially some of the more artsy pieces, that serve only as ambiance. The elevator buttons which are suppose to be more futuristic looking are a touch screen that only senses you pressing every 3rd time. Besides the room the bar and night club really are the place to be on a thurs-sat. night. With a a DJ playing solid music and very attentive bar staff it's a good location to throw back a few. Besides the main bar they also have another bar a smaller bar on the side that is a little bit more mellow but's also a good scene. Staff was friendly and helpful whenever needed and room was always clean.

Reviews.Title: “What you Want”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock_Wallace
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the old town near the tourist sites before I opted for a different location. The hotel is near the river and in a nice, but not touristy area, walkable to many shops and restaurants. If this is your first time in Istanbul though, the old town may be a better option for walking to the sites and has better mid-range hotel options.. I booked the lowest rate and ended up with a "fabulous" room. This was nice as it had an outdoor balcony, but it rained the day I was there. The rest of the room was very nice, clean, and comfortable. Not overly large though. Service was mostly great. Nothing to really fault them on. As with all W hotels they try hard to be hip and mostly pull it off. The lounge was hoping on a Saturday night with well-off locals. But $15 drinks aren't really for me. All in all a very good hotel. Only question, is it really worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, amenities, location”
Reviews.Author: Lesa S
Reviews.Content: Last March a girlfriend and I got a great deal on a weekend stay at the W Istanbul. It was a fantastic place to stay - close to the fancy shopping district, but also embedded in a 'real' neighborhood with plenty of good, inexpensive (especially with the exchange rate to Turkish lira) restaurants closeby. The room was small but perfect, with a huge flat-screen TV, a hip shower (unfortunately I kept pulling the orange ring thinking it was the water...ha ha, it made an emergency call! Handsome young man at the door enquiring as to whether we'd slipped and fallen!Thankfully my roommate wasn't too upset by that!). Bliss cosmetics is the brand of amenities, really great to use and replaced daily. The restaurant is really good (and again, half the price of the euro at that time). Imaginative, fresh, delicious food. The various bars are charming (although the drinks are not cheap - a signature pomengranate-and-bubbles was pricey). The staff is gorgeous, reflecting the beautiful diversity of the city's population, and I had the best massage ever from Flurya (a Tartar, she proudly told me). The day spa is really pleasant. So is the concierge (although his choice of an external restaurant was less than totally satisfying...we could have eaten better in the hotel!). You definitely get the W branding experience here, from the remixed lounge music in the bars to the skullcap hat offered in your room. But the bling-bling Arabian-nights-meets-70's-bellydancing-outfit esthetic is grand and over the top (there is one weird staircase that doesn't go anywhere). Going through a metal detector at the front door is - well, welcome to the world. I appreciate the security. And the Turkish apple tea that is fragrantly brewing just inside the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “modern stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: sum0104
Reviews.Content: A nice stay. There are many nice places and restaurants nearby. The room is hip and modern. The amenities provided are more other hotels. Curious is that there is no hair dryer in the room, but when I called the staff insisted that there is one under the sink... anyway, it didn't spoil my fun there. hm... the corridor is too long... The decoration is a bit over - just like a karaoke centre in HK. btw, the outlook of the hotel is superb at night when the lights are on.

Reviews.Title: “World's best Concierge?”
Reviews.Author: tonyusher
Reviews.Content: Had four wonderful nights at W Istanbul in a Cabana room and what a delight! OK, may not be as classy as say, W Hong Kong (subject of another review - almost brilliant!), but a most enjoyable stay due mostly to the amazingly efficient Cem who is the Concierge. Not only did he work nearly every hour of the day and into the night, but was always enthusiastic and helpful with some fantastic tips for eating, shopping and sight-seeing ideas. W has a real gem here, but my view is they are working him way too hard and he needs some assistance. I watched him handle 3 lots of people in fromt of him whilst working 2 telephones at the same time - truly a professional! His restaurant recommendations were superb. A definite "YES" for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: possiblebliss
Reviews.Content: Im so glad we stayed here. The location was excellent (you cant really walk to Taksim square from there) it was a 10 minute walk from the Dolmabache Palace and Besiktas. We walked to Ortakoy from our hotel and it took us about 15 minutes. It was very easy to get around. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The concierge helped us on a daily basis, with boat schedules (we went to the Prince's Islands) and booking restaurants for us as well as helping us narrow down our choices for nightlife. We stayed a total of 4 nights, the lighting is a bit dim but it didnt bother me at all and there are different settings in the room which gave us very cool options. The bathroom setup was very different from what im used to but it was very interesting. The bed was very comfortable and the Bliss products all smelled yummy. The ipod dock came in handy, Breakfast every morning was delicious with a wide range of choices, and the staff there was also very sweet and helpful. There was a small supermarket just down the street so we were able to buy a few things from there instead of paying hotel prices and there is a great bar/ restaurant right next to the hotel. We had a very enjoyable stay and i would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: chipchop_1
Reviews.Content: Was overwhelmed by the looks of the hotel. Stayed here for over a week on a business trip, but my wife joined me after several days. We had a lovely room with a cabana. Room was spacious and looked great. Expected staff to be a bit friendlier, but were great in accomodating our needs. If in Istanbul, stay wat the W.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: TDHArizona
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one evening while awaiting a rental apartment to open up. The hotel upgraded my room to a suite which was large and very nice. I loved that there was an ability to play my ipod and listen to music in the suite. The staff was exceptional and helpful. I have stayed at many W Hotels in the USA but found this one to easily be my favorite. I ordered room service which was great and delivered in 20 minutes. The hotel has a very nice gym. There are many cafe's and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. I did not bring my computer but free access to computers on main floor in a private room.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul in 36hrs!”
Reviews.Author: NoBagsChecked
Reviews.Content: First off, I am a huge Starwood Fan, I am a platinum member and average 55 stays a year. My wife and I were not sure what to expect from Istanbul, no one we knew had ever gone and we were only going to be there for 36 hours before our cruise left. The W says it's in a nice residential area and I can confirm this completely! Just a short walk up the road and your in an area filled with restaurants that have outdoor seating, shops and parks. The hotel arranged for a 1 day tour, the guide was incredible, he had a clean van and took us all over town, basically the city tour on speed! He didn't let us get into any situations at carpet stores, took us to his favorite restaurants and even joined us after the tour for coffee up on the hill. I would have complete faith in the hotel to arrange your tours, but don't pay through them otherwise you will pay additional fees. The room was great, big, modern with a rain head shower, we only spent a day and half in town but we both agreed that we need to go back and we will stay at the W again when we do.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: meezooy2k
Reviews.Content: The beds are so comfortable and big, the rooms are sexy the food is excellent everything about this hotel is just sexy

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not for business”
Reviews.Author: TTooma
Reviews.Content: As a very frequent business traveller, I would not recommend the hotel for the business traveller. Rooms are small, dark and really not confortable. However, the hotel is in a great location and walking distance to almost everything. Suggest SAS Radisson or Four Seasons as alternates. TT

Reviews.Title: “Such an amazing place”
Reviews.Author: gferraez
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, the hotel has a mysticism that amazed and bedazzled me and my wife, the Ligthing and architecture, are amazing we had a great time The location is amazing to very central

Reviews.Title: “terrific place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: livewell11
Reviews.Content: extremely friendly and professional staff; always with a smile and a "what else can I do for you" attitude. A peaceful and sophisticated location, and close to everything you want to see. Fun and spacious rooms with unbelievable rain forest showers and all the amenities you can wish for. The GM is American and understands how to achieve the perfect mix of catering to Western expectations while introducing you to this fascinating Turkish culture. A comfortable/reassuring "home" in the midst of a vibrant, fast paced city.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel - Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: NCPETE
Reviews.Content: Overall the W is in a very upscale part of Istanbul. The hotel was very modern and staff was great. The bar prices were ridiculous. bar is gorgeous, but completely empty. Rooms were nice we had two. The upgrade we got on the fourth floor actually we like less. It had a little balcony overlooking a parking garage that we never used and a skylight that made sure you were up early. Mosque is right next door so call to prayer at 4 AM is plenty loud. We used points to stay here as it was the only way we could afford it. There is a great coffee spot next door Kahve something with great chocolate. Don't eat locally - restaurants you can walk to are aggressive and cheap. Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value great location”
Reviews.Author: Frankdell
Reviews.Content: Checked in and was immediately upgraded to a junior suite. Pleasant staff with knowledge of good bars and restaurants. Great for a traveler from a major city that is looking for something out of the ordinary. It's away from the hoards of budget travelers looking for a cheap room and meal. I am a big fan of the W chain and this place does not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Paying a lot for coolness, not much else”
Reviews.Author: Ezra99
Reviews.Content: You have to be the type of person who feels cool being at a W for this place to be worth it. Everything about the place tries really hard to be hip, from the mood lighting in the lobby and rooms, to the loungey music playing everywhere, to the bathroom bedroom combination layout in the room. If you don't feel like part of the "in crowd" from that, all you have is an overpriced hotel without that many amenities located a long ways away from most stuff and that overcharges for every little service and add-on.Â  It's a long walk to the tram to get to tourist areas. The Internet is insanely expensive, as are the bottles of water in the room - though both look like a bargain compared to the lounge. It's annoying having the bathroom unseparated from the bedroom. Â And the hotel has basically no views to offer, especially relative to the other luxury hotels in town.Â  The bed is great, and the staff is nice as you'd expect from a W.Â  If you're going to splurge, stay somewhere nicer, and if you don't need to splurge, stay somewhere closer to all the sights.Â

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant location with excellent staff in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: kjzrsz
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptionally helpful, especially the concierge. He made dinner reservations for us according to the food we wanted and the price point that we requested. The staff at the front door also ensured that the taxis knew where we wanted to go and were always there to assist us. The neighborhood is very cute and pleasant to walk around and not touristy and croweded. The lobby like all "W"s was very chic, but a bit dark. The rooms are interesting with the sink, WC and shower behind doors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff. Location grows on you. Small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: sidripley
Reviews.Content: These reviews warned us that location was kinda out of the way...but after you have experienced the market, Blue Mosque etc, you appreciate getting away a bit. Loved that there is a Supermarket with good wine, cold beer by the bottle and lots of goodies just across the street. Was able to walk to the outdoor theater and see Paul Simon's first concert ever in Turkey. Staff kind and helpful except should have warned me more about cabs. Cab 1 dropped us off at midnight at what was supposed to be a nightclub. Walked around for 75 min and never found it even though hotel said everyone knows where it is. Then really awful, scary cab ride back to hotel took us so out of the way through tunnel at 100KM/hr so he could over charge us. Be forwarned, there is no "W" in turkish I guess so saying "The W Hotel" is a problem, even at the airport....have a card with the name and address written on it to give drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: anGElikaNYC
Reviews.Content: amazing hotel. great location, steps from trendy Nisantasi area, near the Bosphorus and DolmabahÃ§e Palace and Macka park. The hotel offers unique experience. Very nice and helpful staff, rooms are very comfy and private patios are simply amazing. Highly recommend this hotel although a little bit pricy but really worth it, especially for short stays. Summer offer, free entrance for Suada pool is also a nice way to kill the day and enjoy the stunning views of the Bosphorus. High 10!

Reviews.Title: “The Cabana Room and the Hotel Area”
Reviews.Author: Biren27
Reviews.Content: The W stands for a signature brand and you expect much more from a W than any other brand. Although the surrounding area is fantastic I think the W does not really provide you with value for money. The general feel of the rooms and the hotel is extremely dark and dingy although this is a W design feature it can be strange sometimes. The rooms are modern, well equipped, comfortable and compact because the WC and shower have separate areas. The breakfast is great and the bar is also pretty fantastic although not too popular with the locals. Overall I would say a good stay, W service is great, the SPA and fitness center are not up to the level you would expect of a W hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location; great couple get-away”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulTraveler2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a newly restored section of Istanbul leading up to Nisantisi, the Rodeo Drive of Istanbul. Very close walk to Nisantisi, with all its shops, cafes and restaurants as well as a quick taxi from the rest of Istanbul nightlife and site-seeing. Very retro-, cool, hip hotel with great service. Also, guests get complementary day passes to Suada, a small, island pool and beach club, which was a great way to get some city and sun on a weekend vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price.”
Reviews.Author: KaiBird
Reviews.Content: Great location. As far as we're concerned the Bosphorous and surrounding area is THE place to be in Istanbul. We liked that the property was not in an obvious tourist location but a local neighborhood to explore, yet easily accessible to taxis and boats etc. 20 min cab ride to major historical sites and tourist destinations. The hotel is not on the water - it would have been great to have a pool or somewhere to cool off in the heat - but then we're talking Four Seasons or Ciragn Palace (aka $$$$). Nice and friendly service, tiny but passable gym, good American breakfast every day. Your typical W with a slightly more funky twist on interior design.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in modern part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ColeyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very edgey and the room we had was fabulous. Staff was very accommodating. The hotel is located away from the maddening tourists and is in the modern area of Istanbul. Fifteen minute walk takes you to public transportation which is very efficient in getting around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish rooms, great bed, good service”
Reviews.Author: jjhaustin
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the W for 5 nights. The front desk and manager were wonderful --helpful with somewhat complex reservations (cash, starpoints and extension of stay). The door attendants were excellent at finding cabs and explaining to the driver the location we were headed (accept this service as it was a challenge when we did this on our own). One concierge was excellent and one was not great at understanding our request/interests. Room service was fast and friendly, but the (American) food was average. It might help to add more Turkish cuisine. The bar was oddly empty and the bartenders were very eager and friendly, but not very polished. The room was stylish, comfortable and an EXCELLENT place to rest. Although the hotel does not seem to be right in the thick of things, it is convenient to everything --a short tram or cab to the historic sites and a short cab or long walk to some of the best bars and restaurants. I truly enjoyed my stay and look forward to returning. Thank you to all at the W Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with excellent service, very modern”
Reviews.Author: realmrtravel
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Turkey, and I did visit several hotels. The W was very welcoming and professional. The day I arrived I had a wedding to go to that evening, one call to the front desk and they came picked up my suit pressed it and had it back in time for the wedding (no charge!). I like 24 hour room service and they provided some well needed meals that are nice to have after returning late when restaurants are closed. The Spa left a little to be desired, it was adequate but very small. I would like to have had wireless Internet included 30TL - $20/day seems a bit high, other than that I was very satisfied with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience overall”
Reviews.Author: asimhusain
Reviews.Content: Being an SPG member and having stayed in the W around the globe I was looking forward to our stay at the W in istanbul. I found the akaretler location charming and the immediate neigbourhood of row houses only added to the overall ambience. Being an ardent supporter of spg properties it is important to understand the distinction between the St. Regis, Westin and W hotels, and we were prepared for the hip urban atmosphere and the lounge/club style decor that the W hotels are known for. What we did not expect was the following experience: 1. Upon arrival to the hotel from the airport, there was nobody there to greet as the entrance, my wife and I rolled our sizable luggage from the taxi to the hotel entrance before we were helped. Somewhat minor but you expect more at â‚¬350/night 2. We were staying at the hotel for 4 nights and I called the whatver/whenever service on day 1 requesting Continuous online access from my room for the duration of my stay, without having to select a daily login. I was informed that the "IT" manager was not around but would get back to me the following morning. We never received a follow up on this issue or call back. 3. Being in a deluxe room on the Top floor (4th floor) we had a skylight over the foot of our bed that was a nice touch however it brought in direct sunlight to the room very early in the morning. The sunlight had a shade that was dysfunctional and required multiple phone calls and finally duct tape to keep closed. Taping it shut seemed like a ugly short term solution. 4. Our pillowcases were stained and had tears in the fabric, holes to be precise, the bed and quality of linen is outstanding but dirty pillowcases unfortunately overshadows the positives in comfort and relaxation. 5. One morning we were outside and looking for help from the bell hop to flag us a taxi, after not being attended to for 10 minutes we were getting frustrated, finally we were acknowledged only to find that the next cab was given to 2 young women that arrived after us. At this point my wife proceeded to tell the individual that we were ahead of the party that just got into the cab. The bell hop got confrontational with my wife and she went back inside to speak with reception about the issue. Although the oversight could have just been human error on anybody's part, the lack of ownership and indignation on the part of the bell hop had us just walk down the street and hail our own taxi. The person at reception was apologetic and proceeded to speak to the bell hop in turkish to get his perspective. An unnecessary escalation that could have been quickly resolved without the indignation and attitude. 6. Other minor issues included oversights in room service like missing the 2 bottles of complimentary water, a magazine that gave visitors like us recommendation of places to visit was removed from our room. The W book with hotel information was also removed without informing the guests. In summary the W in istanbul was capping our 2 week vacation of athens,santorini,mykonos and finally istanbul, and after having truly wonderful stays at the other hotels we were extremely underwhelmed by our experience at this hotel. Any one of these issues in isolation would not have triggered me to write a review but the cumulation of these experiences left me feeling like I need to share the feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Great W hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nannamac
Reviews.Content: Another stunning W hotel from the outside you know that you are staying somewhere special with traditional Turkish building yet inside theÂ Stunning beauty of a w hotel. Â However being a old building the hotel is split over different levels which is interesting Good welcome to the hotel and efficient check in. Â Room nicely appointed with signature W bedding however the pillows are disappointing not the same as w hotel London. Only issue was the bar fridge didn't work and after 3 days of complaining it Â was eventually replaced disappointing it too so long and then on check out the next day was charged for two beers during the time the fridge was broken. Â Really we wouldn't drink hot beer!!! Yuk! Â  A few service issues with bar staff not understanding English and not being attentive and overcharging because they thought we were with a function ($10 more per drink than the night before for the same drinks) when questioned they said sorry and then charged the same price to our room as the previous night. Â  The bars are very well designed and loved the terrace bar.Â  Downside was the massage in the spa first off it's not the normal w spa experience very small no changing area and no showers offered. The massage from the male was poor to say the least seemed rushed and unorganized style would do legs then back then legs again instead of concentrating on one area an doing that well. Too much oil was used and then not to be offered a shower was not nice to change back into clothes. Â When signing the bill I was asked for a tip!! Not very professional and awkward to say the least I really wanted to say do a massage course I tipped $40 under pressure which ended up being $60 on the bill. So watch out for that.Â  In saying all the above did I like the w hotel Istanbul..... Yes I did the above are areas that need attention but as huge W hotel fans I wouldn't stay anywhere else. It's just disappointing when your normal experiences are not metÂ

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: HalleAndTheWorld
Reviews.Content: This is not my favorite W in the world. It's smaller with fewer amenities, and not in a central location. When construction woke (and kept) us up two mornings in a row, they kindly gave us an upgrade (from room 304 to 555). And the concierge was quite useful in helping us select restaurants and make reservations. The service was by far more impressive than the physical location. For this price ($500+/night), however, I'd stay elsewhere if I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: hedger2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Hotel is stylish and modern with lovely rooms. The breakfast is poor and expensive. My biggest gripe would be the service in the bar area - even though the bar was empty all of the nights I was there it was difficult to get a drink and the bar was not even stocked with the advertised beer. I asked for 5 beers and had to take a selection as there was not 5 beers of the same brand lol - thats poor for a 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff/Concierge, great location and hip rooms”
Reviews.Author: SwissScrivs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful weekend in Istanbul. We were in town for a wedding and somewhat limited with our free time. As we did not want to come to Istanbul and miss seeing the main historic sites we asked the concierge (Cem) to help us out by organizing for us an airport pick-up and a half day private tour of the city. Everything worked perfectly. The hotel organized a nice Mercedes to pick us up, take us to the old town where we met a guide while the car continued on with our luggae to the W hotel. The guide was incredible! He teaches history at the local university and has been a guide for the past 20+ years. Besides being very knowledgeable he was also very friendly (he has shown around the likes of Bill Clinton, etc...). The W hotel itself is in a beautifully restored historic building, which combined with the W design makes for a great contrast. The rooms are as you would expect from a W hotel - modern, very clean and design focused, whcih is what my wife and I like. Unlike some other W hotel the rooms are generously proportioned. The staff was incredibly helpful throughout our stay, organizing taxis, making sure we arrived at the wedding on time, etc. Given our social obligations we did not have a chance to sample the restaurant or spend time at the bar but it appeared like the hotel has a happening bar scene. We would definitely stay there again and can highly recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - as other W hotels”
Reviews.Author: Jane_Saturday
Reviews.Content: Incredible hotel! A bit expensive, but definitely good value for money if you look for a stylish luxury hotel for your business partners or a romantic weekend in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a bad location”
Reviews.Author: Melbourneworld
Reviews.Content: The location is the real issue as the traffic in Istanbul is terrible so it takes forever to get anywhere. We stayed in another hotel in the old city for a few nights and would highly recommend anyone going to Istanbul to stay in the old city. Another thing that got me upset is that there was no coffee facilities in the room! for the price you pay you really should have tea and coffee facilities. Also WIFI was a complete Rip off. I still don't understand why some hotels charge you for WIFI when the local backpackers around the corner gives it away for free!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but could do with improvements”
Reviews.Author: gaurav797
Reviews.Content: very trendy hotel however, we thought it was a bit too expensive for what we got. the location is alright, could have been better if it was on the water. the food was good to. the bar was brilliant. but somehow it lacked that something special.

Reviews.Title: “Disgrace to the W name”
Reviews.Author: Chukcha_reader
Reviews.Content: I've seen different W hotels, mainly in the US and always loved them for design, quality of facilities and great service. Obviously, I expected the same from this W. Sadly, my expectations were not met. The hotel is located on a hill. So if you are on the first or second floor (that's where I was - don't know what the other floors are like), you are basically underground with no daylight - the rooms are facing back of the hill. The room itself was horrible. There was no bathroom. Instead, toilet and shower are small closet-like spaces with doors opening into the front part of the room. If you are claustrophobic, forget about taking a shower. Any hotel room, even in smaller-brand and cheaper hotels, usually has some basic things like shower cap, personal kit, etc. Not here. Even when requested, it took some time for them to understand what it was I was asking for. And of course, during the following 4 days of my stay the items were never replaced. Service. What kind of service can you expect from people who are called not with titles assuming their functional responsivilities (like 'bell boy', 'room cleaning', etc.) but instead - 'talent'. They walk around with this huge chip on their shoulders knowing that they are 'talent'. And the guests are there, of course, to appluad. Except there is absolutely nothing to applaud for. Like one of other reviewers mentioned before me, the staff is only interested in bar guests because those are the ones who spend lots of money there (W bar is one of the well-known hang-out places in Istanbul) The week before my experience with W, I stayed at Park Hyatt. This was the best hotel experience I've had in a long time. Besides absolutely gorgeous and well-equipped room, this was the place where one feels cared and provided for every minute of his/her stay.
