So given this benchmark as well as my prior stays at other W hotels, I think this one is a disgrace to the W name

Reviews.Title: “Stylish digs with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: staceyinnyc17
Reviews.Content: The W is a beautiful hotel with gracious service, clean and comfortable rooms, and hip public areas. As other contributors have pointed out, the hotel is not walkable to any major attractions, and the tram is 15 minutes away by foot. On the one hand, it can be nice to stay away from the tourist areas and experience a newer part of town. On the other hand, constantly shlepping and paying for cabs can be trying after a few days. Still, 100% worth it if you're staying on points. On a positive note, the service at the hotel is bar none. Doormen are always at the ready to help with luggage and hail a cab. Keep an eye out for Turgay, who works at the front desk; after arriving bleary-eyed and exhausted, he made sure our check-in process was smooth and expedited, and kept an eye on whatever we might need for the remainder of our stay. We also found both concierges to be hugely knowledgeable. We had done lots of restaurant research before going and thought we knew enough, but they supplemented our lists with gems of places that were delicious and not frequented by too many other tourists.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: GoBlueBoston
Reviews.Content: We knew when we booked our reservation at the W that it was not in Sultanahmet and was a bit far from most of the tourist sites, but decided not to let that deter us. I don't regret our decision because we liked seeing some of the less touristy areas of the city, but I don't think I'd choose to stay in this area again. It just took up too much of the day getting back and forth from things - it is at least a 10-15 minute walk to the trolley, and then another 15-20 minute ride to get down to the main area of Sultanahmet. The hotel is a short cab ride from Taksim (if you are adventurous enough to try something new, do take advantage of the shared cabs, called "dolmus" - they are set up on pre-determined routes and are much cheaper. There are a bunch that go to Taksim just around the corner from the hotel.) The neighborhood of Besitkas behind the hotel is really great to stroll through - but it is NOT a tourist area. We loved the authenticity of the neighborhood - particularly the area around the fantastic open-air fish market - but be prepared to feel out of your element. We liked our room and the hotel itself was nicely maintained and attractive, but we were a bit disappointed that the nightlife at the hotel's bars and restaurants definitely seemed to be lacking. I really expected it to be a bit more lively. Also, it was very difficult to get our hands on one of the laptops reserved for guest use (I believe there is supposed to be a 20 or 30 minute limit, but a guest took one of the two computers to their room and kept it forever - and we really had to push the front desk to track it down for us after continually checking in with them for an hour.) All in all, a typical (in a good way) W hotel in a off-the-beaten path - but still nice - location. But not the best choice if you are only in Istanbul for a short period of time and want to see all the standard sites.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the tourist sites, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: rgam
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the W Istanbul. The location is fantastic as it's easy to get anywhere, but at the end of the day you're away from all the tourist attractions and it's a nice, relaxed feel. The hotel is walkable to many locations and to the light rail, ferry, and (of course) taxis are plentiful right outside. The rooms are small but comfortable. The one downside of the rooms is that the shower doors do not seal and, therefore, you get a lot of water on the floor of your room everytime you shower. Other than that, the rooms were fine. The bed was extremely comfortable and we got a good night rest each night we stayed here. Finally, we felt the staff here were good. The concierge was very welcoming and able to help us explore new parts of town through identifying interesting restaurants off the beaten path. The front desk staff was helpful and we felt the hotel was very safe.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best beds in the world”
Reviews.Author: gypsytravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Istanbul at the Hilton and the W on my recent trip and I have to say that in the future I will stay at W. What I liked: 1. The staff was incredibly attentive, I could not walk into the hotel without being greeted by all staff, and if I was sitting in the lobby for two minutes someone would ask if I needed anything. I have never seen such attentive, but non intrusive staff at any hotel. There are always staff milling around to help. 2. Incredibly clean-there was always staff cleaning the hotel. Regardless of what time I went to the fitness centre there was always someone cleaning in there. I also saw staff wiping down cooridor walls and the room doors, this hotel is immaculate. 3. The bed-hands down one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. I spend about 200+ nights in hotels a year, so this is a big statement, but definitely one of the most comfortable beds. 4. The ambiance-the hotel is beautifully decorated, there are a lot of open spaces for sitting, lounging or hosting coleagues. The bar, restaurant and lounge are all top notch with great food, beverages and service. 5. The location-the hotel is in a great location, close to Taksim and close to tha Kabates metro station. This makes it easy to navigate the city either for meetings or for tourism. In addition there are many restaurants near by and a supermarket, basically everything you need. Overall, this was a great hotel experience. There are no negatives except for the high prices for add-ons such as water, in room internet, etc. But that is what all of the W hotels are like, so my advice go to the supermarket and buy some water and use the free wifi in the public areas.

Reviews.Title: “Liked a lot- but not enough for 5/5”
Reviews.Author: extra_leg_room
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April for a weekend away. Was our first experience of a W Hotel, and overall was pretty satisfied- though there were a few things we were a little disgruntled with. Liked: - The location. On the nicest street in Istanbul we saw during our stay. You need a taxi to get to the historical/tourist sights, but there was always one waiting for pick up on the doorstep of the hotel. - The ambience. Cool decor, nice lighting, lounge music throughout. Great for a weekend away. Not sure how it suits to a business stay, but we liked it. - The room. Nothing spectacular but furnished tastefully enough, and the shower/wet room was great. Cool music on the Bose sound dock, or can play your own ipod through it. - The concierge. Helpful for all that we needed of them and assisted with dinner reservations and concert tickets which was appreciated. Dealings with front desk staff was generally good too. Didn't like: - The first room we were put in (424 I believe). This was at the far end of the coridoor alongside all the industrial sized heating/AC equipment. It was physically vibrating the room! No guests should have been put in this room. We were moved two doors door to a vacant room, which was fine. The front desk staff should have assigned us this room in the first case as I cant imagine anyone would accept staying in the first room. - Price of incidentals.......Seriously, we've stayed at plenty of great hotels around the world, but the mark up on the minibar items was just ridiculous. Go over the road to the supermarket to get snacks or drinks at 1/15 of the price (I am not exagerating). The breakfast buffet was similarly over-priced for what you got (50TL). We just ordered off the menu instead for something half the price. - Taxis. Not a comment directed at the W as such, but Taxi's in Istanbul were a nightmare. Felt people were ripping you off everytime, and rarely going the most direct route in instances when the meter was on. Have the door staff speak to them before you get in one I would suggest. Besides that, enjoyed Istanbul, and all things considered above, we'd probably stay in the W again if we were to return.

Reviews.Title: “Tries so hard to be quirky it fails on the basics”
Reviews.Author: JPetch
Reviews.Content: I booked into the hotel through work back in February mainly out of curiosity. I had never stayed at a W before and they were due to open one in London not long after. I booked a double room through work but got to my room to find it a twin. Usually I do not mind a Twin however this room was so small it made it hard to move around the bed area. Furthermore, I really do not like it when they do not tell you they only have a twin until you get to your room and the porter who did not speak English was of no help at all. I phoned reception only to be told they did not have a spare room. Later in the evening I had another moan and of course they eventually found a room for me. There was a wardrobe, no drawers and the shower/toilet were in small cupboard like rooms off the bedroom with the sink behind two pull back doors. This is to save space, as like I mentioned, the room was tiny. The shower door was completely useless and water flooded onto my carpet next to the bed making it damp the entirety of my stay. The rude lady on the front desk was not a one off. The waiting staff in the restaurant at breakfast were rude too and completely useless. They also charged way over what we ordered and were not quick or apologetic when fixing the bill. The waitresses in the bar are even worse as they know you are not a 'big spender' and only want to get rid of you before the evening really gets busy and you are taking up valuable seating space. The bar is so loud that even when we went down to the lobby for a drink we could not really hear each other. Winding down after a long day is not an option in this hotel. The lighting in the hotel is also extremely frustrating. The corridors are long and dark, the lifts are almost pitch black too. The mood lighting next to your bed is so confusing that turning the light on in the night is a hard task. To be honest, most of the above problems I usually don't moan about too much but with a hotel like the W you tend to get more frustrated because they are trying so hard to be quirky, alternative and stylish that when they completely fail on the basics you immediately get annoyed. I'm not a big moaner when it comes to hotels but I use trip advisor so much when booking hotels that I feel I should start reviewing them too. I will rate some good hotels after this one to prove i'm not all bad! The W could be a great hotel and I guess the other W's could be great but I really could go on and on about the problems with this hotel and I certainly won't be paying to stay in any of them in the future.

Reviews.Title: “No A/C, nosiy rooms”
Reviews.Author: rjn21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in 2 weeks total of 6 nights on busines in April 2011. First week room was great. Room 210, which is on the longer right hand corridor if looing at the holel from the front. Room looked out onto the street.. Large, quiet, no issue with neighbour noise transferrance. The fit out of the room was very modern, cool and funky. Nice lighting panel with different options for amount of lighting. Excellent towels, better than the Kempinski. Bath robes not so good and were waffle cotton that was too thin and stuck to you if damp. Bathroom was adjoining the bedroom and was fine even though part of the same room. Key problem was no air conditioning. The corridors were 25oC (as shown by the a/c thermostats) despite being set at 18o. In room temperatures were similar. Upon calling Whatever Whenever they sent someone up, who then needed to adjust the central computer. A/C then came on, but only overnight. Repeat same phone call at 8am and 8pm every day for a week to get the AC on. Second stay was in 356 I believe, which is on the shorter left corridor if looking from the front of the hotel. Despite being the same room rate as 210, this was half the size. This room is not acceptable if the bar in the street below is open and you want to sleep - simply you cant due to the music. Asked for a new room or a checkout and a new room was found, â‚¬50 cheaper. Room 236 I think, at the very end of the right hand corridor looking inwards into the buildings. Twice the size of 356, bigger than 210. AC worked, room smelt damp and musty, likely due to the odd shower configuration others have mentioned. It seems room layouts are not consistent so some are better than others. Staff average, not helpful, tpyical W attitude like 5th Ave W in NY. Breakfast average to below average. 2 cereals, yoghurt, fruit, Turkish, scrambled egg and sausage. Compared to the room service menu which has a great choice on it, brekafast buffet a bit lacking. Wouldnt stay again given inconsistency and risk of noisy room.

Reviews.Title: “W Istanbul is THE place to stay in town”
Reviews.Author: DanderDukes
Reviews.Content: The arrival experience felt authentic to the newer, fresher part of the city in which this hotel is situated. The lobby is beautiful, certainly a place you would intend to watch day turn to night. Plenty of natural light, but the palette kept that low-lit relaxed feel. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful -- the concierge Cem worked his magic on some of the hardest reservations to get in town. Our Fabulous room was exactly that - Fabulous. Beautifully designed with no signs of wear - we felt like we were the first guests to stay there. We also really enjoyed our meal at Minyon. We came back from dinner past midnight and the place was going off. There was a fashion show going on at the W lounge, so we stopped in for a drink. Definitely a taste of Istanbul's cultural class. We expected a noise night back in our room, but didn't hear a thing except when we had a final night cap out on our cabana. All in all, a great stay. We'll definitely be back. PS, they have an emergency cord in the shower, so don't pull it thinking it will raise the blinds - you'll get a phone call in 5 seconds to make sure everything is alright.

Reviews.Title: “Old style W, new style clientele”
Reviews.Author: TheMuscatFox
Reviews.Content: W Hotels are either in brand new or refurbished buildings - this one is an old one. After a slow taxi ride from the airport it was great to enter the W lobby and chill. I had specifically requested a quiet room and got exactly that. It was on the 2nd floor with its own private garden balcony, such a shame I wasn't there in the summer. The room was the usual 'W' standard, a fantastic wet room with the best ever shower and a quirky separate sink. The bar was an 'in' place and full of trendy non-residents - it is a destination in it's own right. One quirky observation was that the bar staff were all male, dressed in black and looked like characters from the League of Gentlemen in terms of sideburns and turned up noses.... Breakfast was really good, they do a dish layered with plain yoghurt, crushed nuts and very finely chopped fruit - exquisite! My only slight critcism is that the W Istanbul baseball cap was not up to the usual standard, I still bought one though. Another great stay in a 'W'.

Reviews.Title: “What a great city, What a great W!”
Reviews.Author: Ermis014
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4nights end of February beginning of March. I went with my mother, it was a gift for her birthday and for relaxing after a difficult I would say period. I knew in advance that I had chosen the perfect hotel for that but as soon as we arrived we realised that we could not have chosen better. I have visited plenty of hotels but none had the style & decoration of W Istanbul! It is modern and traditional at the same time, "light" & "dark" , a large bed that can give you the rest you need after a day of discovering the beauties of the city, a restaurant that can offer you a delicious food combined with a high standards sevice & a great bar-great choice for those staying a bit more late than we did..! No need to say that all w people (starting with the gentleman of the guest service who had proposed a very nice movie to watch & whose name I am afraid I do not remember up to the general manager) are very friendly and there to assist you with everything you need! So, take some days off your job, book a ticket to Istanbul & of course be prepared for a WOW stay in W Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Dutch_75
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the W Istanbul. The hotel is just simply superb: beautiful and quality design, it has a funky atmosphere with great parties at the W Lounge (fantastic and beautiful crowd). It's just simply a very fun place to be. And last but not least, what a fantastic staff, they were all very friendly and helpful. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort to the maximum”
Reviews.Author: mbawab
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our Honeymoon in W Istanbul and the experience was so special. The hotel is a mixture of old and modern design with fashionable room decoration and light system.. Must try the super comfortable bed. The Staff are wonderful, very friendly and very helpful, and the food was so tasty. The hotel is located in prestigious calm district; normally not a touristic area but not far from Taksim square and very close to Dolmabahce Palace. There is a super market just the other side of the road and a Mall 15 mins walking.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, trendy with very helpful staff in a nice area of the city”
Reviews.Author: geo30
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for 4 nights in early Jan in W Istanbul and it was a great experience. The hotel is in a nice commercial & business area of the city (not the old section) with lots of shops, bars and restaurants in walking or 5 min taxi drive distance, very close to Besiktas centre and around 15 min walk from Dolmabahce Palace. The hotel is trendy and indeed lobby and common areas look like a club -but in style- and did not annoy us at all (although our clubbing years are long gone!). I particularly liked the elevators design. We stayed in a fabulous room which is at the top floor of the hotel and has a nice little terrace, catching a glimpse of Bosphorus view. Unfortunately the weather was cold and rainy so we did not enjoy that as much as we wanted. Bed was wonderful so was equipment. The bathroom was spacious, no bathtub but a large marble rain forest shower area did the job for us. We ate at the two restaurants of the hotel Frederic's (dinner) which was very nice and Minyon (lunch) nothing special but decent. The bar was also lively with good music and nice crowd on fri night we visited for a couple of drinks. The hotel had also a gym but did not visit. Staff was very helpful with special thanks to Cem (concierge) who took such good care of us during our stay - I was actually a bit afraid of what i might meet re. staff service from previous reviews but we were treated very well in all areas hotel (lobby, check in-out, room service, cleaning, restaurants & bar). Overall a very nice W experience just a bit too pricey but would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Funky!”
Reviews.Author: bewlaybros
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of nights. Very different. Did not like the dark feel to the place and thought it was overpriced, specially the minibar, Â£5 for a packet of peanuts?!! The position is very good, with plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. I would say it is a very good hotel, clean etc, however, I would not stay here again as it lacked charm and I could have been anywhere in the world. Next time I visit this great city I will try and find something more "local". People looking for somewhere "trendy" might love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a hook.”
Reviews.Author: doctorbillps
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the W. It is a great hotel with an excellent staff although we did spend any significant time at the hotel. The location is terrific. There is one caveat however. We did not expect breakfast to be included in our reservation. Nonetheless, following a late check-in the night before, we were awakened by a phone call informing us that we had missed breakfast and that the hours were 7:00 to 11:00 am. When we attended breakfast the next day, we had to sign on a list with our room number. I can think of no other explanation for these behaviors unless breakfast was included. We were told on our check-out day, following breakfast, that breakfast was not included and was $30.00 per plate. Not a bad breakfast if you want it. When we told the receptionist and the manager about the inadvisability of the phone call, we were told that it was impossible. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: michael_portz
Reviews.Content: I love W hotels in general but this one shows that it's the first in Europe... it needs a make-over. Its location is not ideal for Istanbul - I would recommend the old part of town instead. Nice and friendly staff. The bed was highly uncomfortable and the matress much too soft. Some of the furniture had ugly staines. There was a general lack of lights in our room. The feeling was a bit dark and gloomy.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel back in 2008....not anymore!!!”
Reviews.Author: Randomcustomer123
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at W Istanbul in October 2008 and I have to say that everything was absolutely perfect at the time....Unfortunately this is not the case anymore - this hotel has deteriorated tremendously!!! This time my overall experience was a complete disappointment and I will never stay at this hotel again! But please let me tell you the whole story. Upon my arrival at W Istanbul I was not greeted at the door and there was no one to take care of my luggage. As I was entering the hotel I saw a " W talent" who did not even greet me and finally after noticing thy I was struggling with my lugage offered to help me I a quite reluctant manner. Where to they find these 'talents' is a mystery to me...I approached the receptio where I was welcomed and asked if I had stayed there before - I told them that I spent 3 nights there in 2008. To my greatest surprise they could not find me in the system...The receptionist gave me the key to the room and wishe me a pleasant stay. What a 'pleasant' stay this turned out to be. I certainly do note recommend it to anybody. Unless you like 'NOISE' and don't care about 'SLEEP'. I went to bed at around 11:00 pm to me awaken one hour later by a noise coming from the next door bathroom- somebody was doing some sort of construction work.. On top of that there was extremely loud music coming from the nightclub, which I was not warned about in advance...I tried to call Gues Services an dialled 0 but to my greatest disappointment nobody answered the phone....I rang them 5 or 6 times with no result...So I had to get dressed and went down to the receptio desk to inform them about the situation. The girl at the reception was kind enough and said she was going to send somebody to Investigate the 'construction' work. I also asked her about the loud music and she told me that it was coming from the nightclub. I went to my room and the noise from The bathroom stopped for a while, unfirtuntely the music from the nightclub was getting louder and louder...So needless to say sleeping was not an option in this room. On top of that the construction work resumed at 2:45 am. Then I could not take it anymore and called reception to ask for a new room. They gave a a new room immeditely- this girl was really professional and willing to help. So I went to my new room and managed to finally fall asleep. On the next morning I called guest services to ask for a late checkout at 14:00. Was told that this was impossible, yet they let me check out at 13:00. So long story short-I left 400 EUR at this hotel and did not even managed to sleep. If somebody was willing to pay this price for a noise then this experience would have definitely been worth it. To and my story I went to the reception desk and saw the same guy who had checked me in on the day before. Naturally I informed him how noisy the room was and this W Talent said: "Oh I forgot to tell you about the party!" What an answer!!! This is totally unacceptable and inappropriate for a hotel chain as Starwood, unless they have decided to get rid of the W brand... To summarize I could have stayed in any of re 5 star hotels in Istanbul and I made a very bad choice, which was based on my previous experience with W. Never again...I am not asking for compensatio although if Starwood was a company who cared slightly about customer satisfaction they would have offered it. Good luck W Istanbul - I hope you will not be able to trick your guests in the future And I should have read TripArvisor inadvance, as there were previous customer who had complains about this NOISE in the past, which is an integral part of W Istanbul's ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Hip to be Cool”
Reviews.Author: MartyBones
Reviews.Content: Trendy and modern this hotel is hip and fun. Super cool room designs and stylish decor. My wife and I celebrated our first anniversary here and we had a blast. Staff friendly and professional. Super clean and room was large. We had a balcony which added alot to the feeling of the place. Besiktas neighborhood is really nice and the street the hotel on is beautiful at night. Definitely a younger hip crowd here. The W lounge is awesomely designed but overpriced drinks didnt keep us there. Ipod dock in the room a huge plus. Very trendy and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Dora002
Reviews.Content: Impressing building, situated at a prestigious district. Due to cityâ€™s heavy traffic, you might wish to avoid taxi transportation and walk to Besiktas tram station & Taxim funicular, approximately 20 minutes walking distance from the hotel. The first impression of the hotel is that you enter to a night club. The lobby is small and the lighting very poor. Guest rooms have also issues with the lighting, especially when some of the spot lights are out of order as there were in my room. The layout of the guest room is unusual and unpractical but I suppose design has to do with the Ws idea. The sink is next to the bed, without partition and opposite the sink there are 2 doors, for the shower and the wc. In any case, I believe the biggest issue in the guest rooms is the noise. I was assigned to a room with interconnected doors. Every night, in order to sleep, we had to wear earplugs, so that we did not have to listen to next door guestâ€™s conversations, corridorâ€™s and night clubâ€™s noise. One night at around 23:30 hrs, I had enough with the loud music, so I called the service line. The reply was â€œoh, yes we have a party â€“ I will notify my manager accordinglyâ€�. As expected, nobody paid any attention to my complain, so we had another sleepless night. The thing is that the reason, we have chosen W Istanbul, was to avoid the crowed and noisy city center. However, it seems that W Istanbul is not suitable for tourists looking for a good nightâ€™s sleep and cozy public areas. Finally, let me comment on the excellent performance of hotelâ€™s housekeeping and Gem at the concierge department, who was most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: jessesomer
Reviews.Content: The W was absolutely perfect! It's trendy, gorgeous, in a great, trendy neighborhood with a lively night life near by. The staff is wonderful - courteous and professional - and very, very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and Trendy”
Reviews.Author: BernhardZurich
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel. Outstanding service and very nice staff. Good location. True: No tub, poor view, but still five stars!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: swatravler
Reviews.Content: The W Istanbul is everything you'd expect from a W. Great staff, very trendy and a wonderful location. My friends and I chose the W for our first visit to Istanbul and were not disappointed. It's not in the old city, but in a very high end trendy part of town. The rooms were spotless and we had a great time at the W Bar...so much fun. I'd recommend this hotel for anyone coming to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: emad800
Reviews.Content: I stayed at W Istanbul during January 2010. It was located in a quiet area within central Istanbul with lots of high end designer shops all around. The staff were extremely helpful. The property was not very big (a 3 story building if im not mistaken) with narrow corridors to the rooms, however, the decoration was just amazing. I stayed at a "Fabulous" room category, and it was spacious and the decoration was quite impressive and creative, not the normal way 5 star hotel rooms are decorated but you will definitely like it. Breakfast buffet was delicious, it felt like there was so much effort in preparing the food. One bad thing about Istanbul is that Taxi drivers are the worst I have seen, and the best thing is to take a taxi that waits outside the hotel through the W hotel staff (at least you will not be overcharged on your way out). All in all, it was a good experience, and I would definitely choose the W hotel if I would ever go to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as expected”
Reviews.Author: firstalways
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at a very nice neighborhood but is 15-min walk to any public transportation. The rooms were very small and the decor felt like a rent-by-the-hour establishment. The staff tried to be helpful and were generally nice. As SPG platinum they would not give me free breakfast but only free wifi. I can think of better options next time I visit beautiful Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, service a bit hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: starjohnday
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a number of clients and colleges and over two nights and found the service a bit hit and miss in that I (we) would receive great service from one member of staff and indifference service from another, specifically at the bar. The design of the hotel is quite unique and I think stepping into the hotel is like a marmite moment; you either hate it or love it. I personally really liked the decor and found the room not only well equipped but very comfortable. One thing though, everything seemed to be hidden behind a door so you have to do a bit of investigating before you found out where everything was. Overall I had a good stay at this hotel and I would choose this hotel again if I was on business however if I was visiting Istanbul as a tourist I may have chosen a hotel that was more centrally located but that is purely a personal choice and should not dissuade you from choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too modern for my tastes, but I would still go back”
Reviews.Author: NoraNJtoLondon
Reviews.Content: You get the typical W experience here- dark lobby, pounding music, walls that glow bright pink, and a room so modern it is difficult to find the toilet immediately. Still, my husband and I enjoyed this hotel. The service was solid, and the concierge was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. Our room was on the lower floor and had a private outdoor sitting area- very nice touch. The shower was fantastic! The hotel is in a residential area, not in the touristy old district of Istanbul. We really enjoyed staying a bit outside of the touristy area. We could walk around at night without being hassled by people, which was not the case elsewhere. After taking a couple of frightening cabs to and from the old city, we decided that the light rail would be much better for our wallets and our safety. The light rail is a short walk (10 minutes or so) from the hotel. We stayed over Easter weekend, and we were surprised to find a little bag of chocolate Easter eggs tied to our door one evening. It was a very nice touch, especially considering that Easter is not a holiday in Turkey. My one complaint is with the restaurant. We had breakfast at the hotel one morning. We asked the price of the breakfast buffet, and the waiter told us (the price was not printed anywhere). When we received the bill, the price was significantly higher. The manager was not all that willing to reduce the bill to what we had been told until we threw a bit of a fit. I understand that there is a language barrier, but this is why prices should be clearly marked on the menu (a la carte prices were printed). It seemed to me that this was par for the course at this restaurant, and it rubbed me the wrong way. After that experience, we decided to eat breakfast at CafÃ© Nero for the remainder of our stay. If we visit Istanbul again, I would gladly stay at the W Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A Modern Touch in a Ancient City”
Reviews.Author: mehulpatel824
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great first trip to Istanbul. Here is some info that might be helpful about the hotel and the city. Room: Upgraded to king size room upon arrival as we are SPG Gold Preferred Guests. As with any W Hotel, this one was also very trendy, hip, and eclectic. Room was typical European size and had nice amenities such as Bose stereo with iPod dock, safe, balcony, etc. Separated toilet and shower was also nice. The rainfall shower head was one of the biggest I have seen and was very relaxing to take a nice shower! The only thing you will have to get use to is the dozen of so light switches. But overall, great room with comfortable bedding typically seen with Starwood properties. Service: The staff was very attentive during our whole stay and was always more than willing to help you get whatever you might need. Concierge was helpful in restaurant recommendations but it might be a good idea to let them know in advance what your price range/budget is so they can steer you in the right direction. Location: The W Istanbul is located in the "new" part of the city. The new part is where all the action is from a ton of cafes, restaurants, bars, lounges, shopping, etc. The old city (esp. the sultanahmet area) is full of tourists so you should do you research before you eat there as the potential for "tourist traps" is probably higher. The W Istanbul is in an area called Besiktas which in itself has a good local scene full of cafes, restaurants, bars, etc within walking distance. The local tram to the old city is about 1 mile away so definitely walkable. Takism and Beyoglu is about a 15 min taxi ride (could be double depending on traffic however). Tips: A few blocks up from the hotel is a liquor store if you need to get wine, beer, etc for your room. You can get a bottle of local wine for the cost of what 1 glass would cost in the hotel bar (although you pay for the trendy scene I guess). Some of the must do's are seeing all the beautiful mosques, experience the grand bazaar, visit the spice market, and take a cruise down the bosphorous! In Beyoglu, there are a ton of good seafood restaurants, esp. on Navizade street. The best durum kebab (sandwich) and lentil soup was at Durum Zade (as seen on Anthony Bourdain). All in all, we truly enjoyed our first visit to Istanbul and our stay at the W Hotel. Taking into consideration the cafes, restaurants, bars, shopping, ease of transportation to old city and experiencing the "local scene" we would recommend staying in the new part of Istanbul. Istanbul is truly a walking city, so you should take every opportunity to walk anywhere and everywhere to get the real experience. Sometimes getting lost is the best part!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful week in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mswk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used points to stay 8 days at the W in Istanbul. It was his first, my second trip to the country and we loved it. Although the reception/lobby were very different than our usual choices in hotels (think St. Francis in San Francisco or quaint Eurpoean in Rome), we grew to love the atmospohere when walking in to the hotel (through metal dectors ) each evening.There is not enough seating in the common area, however to use the free Wi-Fi easily. Our room (on the 4th floor) was not huge, but big enough for the two of us. We did find enough drawer space for the week, using the side tables. The bed was sooo comfortable. A great sleep after walking the seven hills of Istanbul. My husband is 6"4" and did find it hard to find a place to sit in the hotel that was comforatble for a man his size, Even the chairs on our small deck where cramped. We really enjoyed the neighbourhood and location. We walked at night to the Beskitas neighbourhood, enjoyed great fish meals at side walk taverns..Watched our fish being cleaned at the local fish market.and then walked over to the restuarant. The energy and non tourist atmosphere were just what we had hoped to have on this vacation. We, too found the grocery store and bought many bottles of local red wine to enjoy on the deck. We walked to and from the tram, did not find it to be a problem at all. (we are in late 50's and from a small midwest town). The stroll along the Bosphorus with the palace and mosque was a lovely change from the crowded bustle of Sultanhemet. We even saw a man with cart, donkey and firewood on the busy street one evening. Cem, the conceriage, arranged a delightful tour to Cappadocia for us and was very helpful in making local dinner reservations for the two evenings we requested his help. We also did a cruise on the Bosporus, leaving from the ferry stop, just 5 minutes from the hotel. There is a safe ATM just 2 minutes from the hotel enterance. We did find a much cheaper shuttle service from the airport on the internet, however, than what he had offered. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “funky style , 24/7 bar in hotel”
Reviews.Author: grinchee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in October 2010. Quite busy traffic on way in from airport - journey took 1 hour. Smooth check in- booked 'fabulous' room (as these rooms have a small terrace- unlike the 'spectacular' category). Lucky to get double upgrade to a suite. Very spacious, great layout and cool interior design (see pics). Friendly helpful staff (like everyone in Istanbul!) maybe a little bit of playing up by Concierge how 'difficult' it is to secure reservations at certain hotspots like Vogue / Mikla on a weekend night when you can call yourself and its easy- such places seem even more keen to accomodate 'foreigners'..or so we experienced.. Nice historic location with restored period buildings a few boutique stores as well as everyday Migros etc., Not ideal if you will be visiting Grand Bazaar alot since traffic in Istanbul is hectic at the best of times but taxis are easily available and plenty of bars / restaurants are within relatively easy reach if you are looking for more of a nightlife program. Room service was good with the item missed from the order being promptly sent to us. All standard facilities included such as Ipod docking station and 42 (?) inch screen Tv with DVD player ) . Internet access is 15 euros although DVD selection could have been better. Gym is ok..4/5 latest technogym running machines plus 1 upright and one long bike and crosstrainer. Not a huge selection of weight machines. There are no wet facilities (spa/ pool etc) in this hotel but the nearby Swissotel offres use of their very comprenhensive leisure facilities for 80 euros pp per day. Istiklaal (shopping for gifts etc area and frenetic but friendly nightlife) area is about 20 minutes in heavy traffic or 8-10 minutes other times. The only down point about our room/ hotel was the 24/7 music they play in the 24/7 bar so if your room faces the inside 'courtyard' area away from the bust traffic street area then you will have to be able to put up with this. Alternatively take a high floor or go in the winter so you dont need any windows open. The music is not so club like that it is annoying but still not ideal. Overall we had a great stay here and would recommend this hotel especially for a younger crowd. Photos to follow..

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WIsil
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful, in the middle of a beautiful residential section and within walking distance to Dolmabache. Very convenient and just enough outside of the crazy noise and traffic. Great shopping and dining within the area. Apparently, the locals call this the "sex hotel". It is very modern and has just a slightly seedy feel to it. The hallways are very dark and the walls have neon pink and blue lights, so I can see why it looks a little bit like it belongs in the red light district. That said, the hotel itself is actually very nice. The people could not have been friendlier. I had a split decision on our room. The mattress was extremely hard, which I guess is good for the back, but it is certainly not something you can sink into. The bathroom is nice, lots of good space, with a separate water closet, which I always like. The shower head is great if you want the raindrop waterfall effect, however, they do not supply shower caps, so be prepared for that. Also, the water pressure is very low, so if you have thick hair and want to wash it, look out! We had a bit of a hard time at first, through no fault of the hotel, merely by location of our room, as the building next door to us was under construction and the electric saws were going until 2 Am! Also, there is a disco right behind the hotel, and we had the very last room on the hall, so we heard the pumping bass very late. The closet leaves a lot to be desired, and there is basically no drawer space, so if you are planning on spending any more time other than one or two nights here, you may have a problem. All that said, we really did like it there and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: john28London
Reviews.Content: To start with the negative: Hotel W takes your money up front, not just a percentage and so when the volcano went up in Iceland we had to rearrange our trip or lose all our money - a substantial amount. I think when one pays a lot one should then have the feeling of being looked after. At hotel W they seek to take more money from you. I assumed wrongly that I had paid for breakfast in the 230eoro price of the room. We were then charged an exorbitant amount for a rather average breakfast. The following two breakfasts were spent at the coffee shop round the corner! I was later told I had got the room at a bargain rate which I simply can't believe.( If only there had been a feeling of generosity this would have been a superb place to stay.) The room itself was really not large. Why should their airport transfer be twice as much as one organised by a superb firm over the internet? Why should it cost twice as much to take a taxi found by them than one hailed in the street? We are independent travellers who fancied a luxurious few nights in a designer hotel. That doesn't mean money was no object and we had taken leave of our senses. The concierge said on being asked about local restaurants that there was nothing round the hotel - only fast food joints. The hotel is set in a jewel of a street but in a poor and inconvenient location. You have to walk along one of the busiest highways in Europe to get to the tram - no not everyone wants to drive around in limosines! Now for the positive: the place seems to have been designed by a gay architect on speed and is no worse for that. It has a mysterious and cool feel to it. The room had wonderful lighting and the bed linen is divine. The bathroom area is really slick. Also I have never known such effecient room service. It is not the staff's fault that the company seeks to rip you off. They are really helpful. The concierge booked us just the best table for dinner and really quickly. We did have a great few days in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for party? This is your hotel! If not, check elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: 102410c
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in a trendy hotel this is the place! Music, dark public areas and rose ligths on the corridors...... however, my pillow was stained ( a very nive "WELCOME" pillow on the bed) and the carpet and couch as well. Not what i expected to see in a W hotel. The bathroom is not confortable if you are going with friends or someone you do not want to see naked when they finish their shower ( the shower consist in only a cabinet inside the roomin which you can not get dressed so you have to leave it et VOILA! you are just in front of the beds.... strage) I think there are much betters options nearby! Maybe one with a Bosphorus view

Reviews.Title: “Yep, it's a W...”
Reviews.Author: flyer351
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. I love the feel of a W. You can have the worst day ever, but when you walk into a W it almost makes you forget about your day. The W Istanbul does just that. It's a place to forget about what's going on in the world and socialize, relax, have a good meal and a few cocktails (or one too many). It's a great mix and the W Istanbul does it in modern Turkish style. It's a comfortable, yet invigorating experience not many hotels are able to achieve. If your young at heart, this is definitely the place to come. It's modern, upbeat, contemporary, chic and it makes you feel good. The service at the hotel is of W standard, truly "Whatever, Whenever". The concierge is one of the best I've ever dealt with... he recommended a lot of great places that match what I was looking for. It was a tailored experience. The location of the hotel is also great. It's a nice area of Istanbul, a quieter area that will soon be full of shops and cafes (there are a few already). It is a short cab ride, or walk up the hill to Taksim (about 20 mins), which is fine by me as it's crazy there. The rooms are typical W style with mood lighting, big TV's, bose waves on the nightstand, cool phones that have the weather and things like rooms service menu displayed on it and a great bed and shower. All in all it's a great experience and if you like the W style, you will truly like this one. It's not a place for people on vacation looking for the typical American hotel experience of bland rooms, decor and personality. If this is you, you probably wont be big on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EYE-POPPING property, AMAZING staff ... but razor-and-blades pricing model is irritating”
Reviews.Author: AndyAndValC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 2 nights in Sept '10, and I'd been here for a few nights in Aug '09. (We travel a LOT for vacation and business; she's Starwood Platinum -- heck, our firstborn had gold status on one airline before he turned 1...) First: as plenty of other have said, the property is just stunning. Very funky-cool, but not TOO hip. It's dark-ish in a good way -- very cool and soothing to come out of the summer heat to, with typical Starwood/W mood music in the public areas, funky decor (lots of purple/magenta subtle neon, faceted costume jewels made into climbing vines in the elevators, silky cord 'curtains' in some of the rooms -- very Starck/moderne without going over the top. Second: the staff is both very well-trained *and* spectacularly helpful (too many places have one or the other but not both). They focus on going the extra little bit, offering things *before* you realize you need them (example: our door-guy, who looked like Jack LaLanne, brought me packets of lemon 'moist-wipes' when I came in from a hot afternoon -- and then handed me some on my way out the following day). The concierge service as good, and thorough, as a CEO's executive assistant (on my first visit, I happened to mention I liked the t-shirts that the staff wore at the coffee place around the corner -- when I came back, there was one waiting for me (!) >;-) The down side (and to be fair, this is probably market pressure at work, in the age of online discount booking): the razors (room rates) are reasonable; the blades (everything else) will kill you. The minibar/room-service prices are what-you'd-expect-crazy-expensive, sure -- I've never seen a $10 room-service burger and never expect to. But: $20-25 drinks in the bar (and I'm not talking specialties - this is for a gin-and-tonic, and not a premium call-brand either)?!? $6-7 for the bottle of water in the room. (They do give you a couple of small ones, gratis, though.) They didn't offer a bottle of wine as a Starwood points gift, as many other W's/Meridiens do -- and the bottle of red in the room was outrageously expensive. We don't travel cheaply -- but we just can't STAND getting nickel-and-dimed -- or outright milked -- just because they've got you right there. *** (Smart travelers will walk barely one block to the Migros supermarket, where a WIDE selection of food & drink (including beer, wine, liquor, etc.) -- and everything else -- is available at VERY reasonable prices.) In-room Internet is really pricey, too (unless you've got SW status) -- AND you have to constantly sign in with a number of things to re-fill-in -- AND you can't have more than one device on at a time. You'd think that'd be enough, but: (A) there were two of us, (B) we also had our smartphones, and (C) we couldn't figure out how to sign off ONE device so another could sign on. Minor annoyances each, but added up, it was an unnecessary irritation. We were also a little irritated that two groups had taken up enough of the hotel that we ended up not only not being upgraded this time -- we're OK with that! -- BUT that we got stuck with what someone else here complained about: a cramped "efficiency" room (335) near the end of the (very long) hallway, with no actual bathroom! There was a sink-in-a-closet, across from a toilet-closet, and a shower-closet. The desk chair, at the foot of the bed, didn't have enough room to sit at a comfortable distance from the desk -- and it was impossible for one of us to get past the chair to the other side of the bed when the other was sitting there. ETC.: The bed was VERY comfy, as others have said, like all Starwood properties. We can't stand those "rainfall" overhead showerheads, although some people inexplicably like water pouring all over their heads and into their eyes! :-) -- and would've liked the shower 'wand' to be in a holder where you can aim it (we ended up with very clean necks). The location isn't bad at all -- you're a 10 minute walk from the end of the local tram line which takes you right to the key tourist attractions; you can also catch the funicular at that station to the top of the hill for the VERY neat Beyoglu shopping/people-watching area. Overall -- we loved it, though -- and will return yet again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice W”
Reviews.Author: stanvard
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the nicer W's. Beautiful rooms designed Hammam-style. Everything else as you would expect from a W. Expensive food, charges for wi-fi and water, too-soft pillows. Not a bad location proximity-wise to explore some urban suburbs and to Taksim Square, but a good 20-minute walk to the tram or funicular and not a lot of restaurants or shops around the hotel. I used Starwood points to stay here, but for the price, would have stayed somewhere else if I had to pay cash.

Reviews.Title: “Where the concierge actually makes a difference.”
Reviews.Author: wikiknowsbest
Reviews.Content: I usually pay no mind to the hotel concierge and they tend to do the same for me. However, things were different at the W Istanbul. I've stayed in several W hotels, but this so far has been the best in large part due to Cem Manglay (sorry if I mangled the spelling). He was so eager to show us around and so proud of his city; it was infectious. A few days into our trip, Cem directed us to a restaurant around the corner but it was closed and he spotted us crossing the lobby with our heads hung in defeat on our way back to the room and he immediately got up and personally escorted us around the neighborhood trying to find lahmajun (we had a craving). It was also my bf's birthday and Cem booked us a wonderful reservation. When we came back to our room, we found a card signed by the entire staff and a decadent chocolate pistachio cake. Such a great surprise. The only unfortunate thing is that the letter "W" does not exist in Turkish so explaining the location of your hotel is a little difficult. The area also caters to the uber rich shopping crowd, one that I don't tend to follow. The street is historic and beautiful to walk around, however. The public transport is also excellent (better than the cabs that get caught in infuriating rush hour bumper to bumper traffic).

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Would Expect From W”
Reviews.Author: balticdude4
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews before booking at the W. It sounded like it was in a good location and within walking distance of most of the hip cafes and shops in the area. Boy, was I wrong! There are few cafes in the area unless you want to get a coffee. None of the hip shops are open yet, so there are very few pedestrians on the street. To get anywhere, you have to catch a taxi, which turned out to be fine because you would find this with several of the other options in Istanbul. The room itself was over the top in some respects, but more like something you would find at a Holiday Inn. The bathroom was bizarre...I had a superior room with a cabanna. The shower opens up into the room so there is no privacy at all. The lighting in the bathroom was so dark that you felt like you were in a night club. I have to say that the people in the hotel were very nice and helpful, except for when the manager woke me up to ask me if I was satisfied with the hotel. Otherwise, they were very nice and helpful. I checked out the Day Spa and I would compare it to a creepy sauna. It is down a obscure corridor and is so dark and tiny that you feel like you just want to get out of there. I'm not sure why the hotel even bothered to have a spa if they were going to make it so uninviting. The breakfast room is very nice, but I would recommend that they include the breakfast in the price. The buffet had a lot of choices, but nothing that you could really eat. The healthy section had celery sticks and some nuts, but unless you are a squirrel, there was not much else which was edible. If they just included the breakfast (and added it to the cost of the room), then it would be more in keeping with what they are trying to convey. It really surprised me that they even charged for a small bottle of water in the room. Again, why not make it free and add the charge to the room? They even charge for the internet although most hotels now offer this for free. Overall, it felt like I was staying in a dark nightclub, but without the ambiance. I walked over to the Four Seasons and I would definately stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worth the Starwood points”
Reviews.Author: ss782
Reviews.Content: We used Starwood points to book two three-night stays at the W Istanbul at the start and end of our trip to Turkey. During our first stay we were upgraded to a fourth-floor Fabulous room; for our second stay, which cost more in points because the basic level room was sold out, we got a Mega room on the third floor. The rooms: Both rooms were good. The Fabulous room had a skylight and a tiny outdoor terrace with a table and chairs, while the Mega room was significantly bigger and brighter with three huge windows, high ceilings and better seating in the room. We much preferred the more spacious room. We thought the outdoor space attached to some rooms was pretty useless, considering there's no view to be had and it's too hot in summer to sit outside. Be very choosy about your room class at the lower end -- our first upgrade, which we rejected, was to a Spectacular room on the first floor, below street level. The room had a little outdoor patio, but it was otherwise smallish and dark; the A/C didn't work well; and the bathroom was basically built right into the room, with the shower and toilet doors opening into the living area, which made the whole space seem even more cramped. If we had been stuck in that room for the duration of our stay, we would be writing a vastly different review. (In any case, we probably would have checked out of the hotel if that had been the only room class available.) By far, our favorite thing about our rooms was the "W Signature" bed, which was indescribably plush and comfortable, with a down feather topper, down pillows, soft sheets and a down comforter -- like sinking into a cloud. Climbing into that bed was a major highlight of each day. We have never slept better. (You'll appreciate the W's beds even more, once you've traveled around the country staying in Turkish hotels.) The bathrooms were also excellent, with big mirrors, huge marble walk-in showers equipped with handheld and rain shower heads, and a separate toilet room. Other cool amenities: DVD player, iPod dock, flat-screen TV, spacious work desk with built-in outlets, current copy of TimeOut Istanbul and complimentary welcome snacks and bottled water for SPG members. The hotel: Free Wi-Fi in all common spaces (in-room access is a total rip-off, which is frustratingly typical of all Starwood properties); comfortable 24-hour bar/lounge with cocktails at exorbitant prices (typical of Turkey); outdoor patio; small but adequate fitness room with free earbuds for plugging into TVs on aerobic equipment; restaurant on-site (we had yummy sandwiches there for lunch one day); prompt room service, though the food can be generously described as uneven. The location: If you're planning to spend all your time in Sultanahmet (Old Town), there are more conveniently located hotels than the W, which is across the bridge in the Besiktas neighborhood, a block from the Bosphorus and northeast of Beyoglu (New Town). That said, the hotel is an easy 10-minute walk to the tram (which goes directly to all the Old Town sights -- Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Cistern, Cemberlitas Hamam, Grand Bazaar, etc.) and a subway stop (which takes you to Taksim Square, where the main pedestrian thoroughfare in Beyoglu, Istiklal Caddesi, begins). You could also take cheap cabs everywhere -- Sultanahmet is about 10 or 15 minutes away by taxi, but there's so much traffic during the day, you'll probably get there faster by tram. We really liked staying in this part of town because it was a lot more Turkish; Sultanahmet is overpacked with tourists and carpet sellers. Besiktas is also conveniently located to Beyoglu and other Istanbul neighborhoods worth visiting for the city's better restaurants and shops. Around the hotel itself, there are lots of high-end boutiques (nothing you can't get in the U.S., though); just up the block, there's a coffee shop and a boutique wine bar, plus lots of little local bodegas and a liquor/wine shop with a good selection of Turkish wines. Overall, we really liked the W and thought it was absolutely worth staying in using Starwood points, but it's hard to say whether we would have picked it if we had to pay cash. The rooms aren't cheap and there is no shortage of luxurious hotel rooms in Istanbul. Other tips: -Giving taxi drivers a street address is futile. Better to direct them with landmarks. So, if you're heading back to the W, which most taxi drivers don't know, tell them it's across the street from Dolmabahce Palace in Besiktas and they'll know where you're headed. -Most of the restaurants we tried served food only until 11p, but stayed open later for drinks. A few places we really liked: Mikla (get the tasting menu and arrive before sunset), Cezayir, Giritli. For baklava, go to Gulluoglu; there's a shop at the Grand Bazaar stop on the tram. We thought Abracadabra, which gets raves, was totally overrated. Check out http://istanbuleats.com/ or http://chowhound.chow.com/boards or other food blogs for recommendations. -Buy a Turkish rug! We didn't have time to, but wished we had.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Glam...”
Reviews.Author: Raspy888
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay...Location was great..easy access to the major tourist areas.. the concierge service is extremely good..all our nights and days were sorted thanks to them..from recommendations on restaurants to spas to shopping everything was A grade. The staff was very courteous and very helpful.. if u are visiting istanbul you can choose this hotel with your eyes shut..

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: tlfraser
Reviews.Content: yes our stay was wonderful - we found that the w was situated in the best part of town for us. we were able to shop and dine around the area and also go to the grand bazaar everyday. it was easy access to kanyon mall and metrocity also. thank you for a wonderful time in you cosmopolitan city tami and micheal fraser

Reviews.Title: “Truly "Whatever Whenever"”
Reviews.Author: Beach246
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about this hotel. The location is great, the staff is probably the best I've ever experienced in a hotel - from the doormen to the desk to the cleaning staff, you can tell they're all there to make your stay the best it can be and make your life easier if possible. As just one example, we got to Istanbul very early in the morning (I think we arrived at the hotel at 6:30am) and the desk upgraded us for free so we could check into a room immediately and sleep. The concierges were super friendly, honest and knowledgeable. They didn't seem to have ulterior motives (and I'm pretty cynical when it comes to that) and they made and canceled several reservations for us with no hint of irritation. Every single one of their recommendations was spot-on and they were both just so pleasant to deal with. We were there as a part of our honeymoon and the hotel brought us an amazing chocolate cake and decorated our room for us our first night. It was incredibly cheesy but the effort was cute. The bed was like heaven and the blackout curtains for the door to the balcony worked perfectly. Their showers were also, well, like heaven. I would avoid the brunch upstairs as it's definitely nothing special and not worth the 45tl per person. You can get much better food at other restaurants within walking distance. Other than that, I have nothing but great things to say about this hotel and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “How Do You Say WOW in Turkish?”
Reviews.Author: templebar8
Reviews.Content: We love the W and stay at the W where ever there is one anywhere in the world. This was our first stay at the W Istanbul and we were very pleased with the location, design and amenities. The hotel is perched on a knoll with a view of the water that can be seen from many parts of the hotel. The immediate location is ritzy with a collection of European designer brands next to local mom and pop eateries nearby. The cobblestone streets, the water view and boutiques felt more like Paris than Istanbul. Being a primarily Muslim country, we were not sure what to expect as far as service considering that we are an unmarried couple and are both minorities. I'm going to assume that service irregularities had to do with language/cultural barriers primarily, but some looks we got felt uncomfortable at times, specifically in the restaurant. Be advised that cocktails are very expensive here--average of $25 per cocktail ($54 for two, although FANTASTIC, mojitos one afternoon). We were not entirely sure, but we won't speculate further other than the service/reception was not entirely on par with other W's we've stayed at. The front desk, concierge and entrance personnel was fantastic. The room was stunning, very roomy and as interesting and beautiful as any other W in the world. We had no noise issues and actually found it to be very quiet for a W. Aside from the minor issues mentioned, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Designer must have envisioned a Space-Aged Bordello with no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: GR8T2BAGTR
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the white, open and sleek interior design of most Ws.. be prepared for dark interiors lighted with spots of white and fuscia neon. One can surmise the designer tried to overcome low ceilings, and a cut-up interior floor plan with darkness to camouflage the apparent reuse of existing buildings. (You walk down a long, narrow hallway with low ceilings on either side off the lobby to get to the main room elevators) I kept thinking of the Arnold Schwarzenegger movie "Total Recall" and the sleazy bar scene on Mars - that's the best I can describe the decor theme employed at this W location. Beyond form - there is the function deficit. A confused staff and a spotty electrical system - the air conditioning was not funcitoning the day we checked in - yet the staff failed to divulge that - (Come to think of it - they turned the air off on the people in the Total Recall Mars bar scene too.) Just like Mars, Istanbul in August is quite balmy to say the least! Oh yes, and Wifi is only free in the lounge and public areas - you pay to use it in your room. And just when you think "Well, how bad can it get?" - we discovered that some genious thought the ideal spot for the door stop would be in the middle of the carpet right as you would walk toward the desk. How many toes have been stubbed to date is anyone's guess. Outside the walls - you are in an area that has little to offfer from a restaurant or shopping perspective. When we stayed we noticed many American accents, so it is obvious we were not alone in booking a trusted brand only to be fooled by this location. For the price - go to the Kapinski or othe Four Seasons. If the air is out - at least they have a pool in case the air conditioning isn't working.

Reviews.Title: “the emperor is not wearing any clothes”
Reviews.Author: wicked123
Reviews.Content: this hotel is just stupid like a bad movie expensive yet no furniture decorated but incredibly dark reminds me of a 1965 Citreon looks like some Turkish pervert`s first job out of prison was decorating a hotel with no pool, no views,no lobby the logistics behind the hotel is all messed up with convoluted long multi story hall ways that span multiple buildings this simply is not a good building for a hotel we were there 2 days one day the AC did not work I am from Atlanta, I KNOW HOT AND HUMId and I have never been so miserable The public space is useless the restuarant is OK but $30 for breakfast $25 for a cheap glass of Chardonay, ? IF YOU RECENTLY WON THE LOTTERY.,BUT HAVE NO TASTE AND DONT CARE ABOUT HAVING A VIEW IN ONE OF THE WORLDS MOST IMPRESSIVE CITIES THIS HOTEL IS FOR YOU The staff was fine i highly recommend the Kempinski

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip and Trendy”
Reviews.Author: marc_arn30
Reviews.Content: Very cool place to stay in Istanbul - very funky and hip hotel. First time in Turkey - so much to see in the city and the W was a great base to see all the sights !!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome combination of W style and Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dre_techie
Reviews.Content: Over the three days spent here my opinion of about the hotel varied greatly. First we arrived and I was impressed by the renovated area around the hotel, the nice shops makes a unique setting for a luxurious modern hotel with styling queues from the region. All was well until we were woken up by the sound coming from the minarets as our room was aligned just in a way that you could hear that. That was solved the next day when we told the front desk and they switched our room - gave us a nice upgrade. Another small issue that was escalated was the fact that they were reluctant to replace the shower gel in the bathroom although we were two people, so of course if the shower gel is low after the first night we were going to need another for the next night. I didn't even take the other toiletries, but they hadn't considered they should replenish those. A phone call plus an explanation of why we would need it solved that. Overall I think it's a great hotel if you don't care about being at a hotel overlooking the Bosporus directly. The bar had a very nice atmosphere, the style goes very well with that of the area.

Reviews.Title: “We Were Treated Like Sultans!”
Reviews.Author: C_Andrea_Go
Reviews.Content: The W Istanbul sets the benchmark for the service among the Starwood chain and is an oasis from the hustle and bustle of Istanbul. From check-in to check out we could not have been treated better by each and every staff member that we came in contact with. I want to separate this comment from the fact it was our 25th anniversary, since not everyone knew this about us. However, the W did mark this event by leaving the most decadent heart shaped chocolate mousse cake in our room (it was too die for). We also had room service one night in our fantastic cabana, not being able to face another kabob, and it was just about the best hamburger anyone could ask for! I would like to especially mention Jim, the tireless and well informed concierge, who continuously jumped through hoops for us with our last minute questions and reservation requests. Plus, he gave us down to earth advice about asking restaurants their pricing on food and beverages, which can sometimes be expensive in Istanbul (wow!). We have found our home away from home in Istanbul and it is the W.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but hotel has too much attitude”
Reviews.Author: zuttoman
Reviews.Content: I'm platnium and have stayed at several Starwood properties including Ws before. I was ready for the small rooms, ambient lighting, and house music blaring all day and all night. That's just a W. I wasn't prepared for the lack of friendliness of the staff and the routine mistakes that they made. When we checked in our reservation wasn't correct; they fixed it by splitting it into two reservations. Halfway through the trip our keys stopped working because of said two reservations. Eventually everything was fixed but it was a hassle and no one ever apologized for the hassle. It seemed to me that they were more interested in looking good at their glamor hotel then actually helping the guests. And they don't really have computers for you to use. They have one laptop that you can check out but, no surprise, during the week I was there it was mostly checked out so bring your own if you want internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great!”
Reviews.Author: ShilpaLakhani
Reviews.Content: Though brilliantly located in Besiktas, Istanbul; the dark ambiance with red and green lounge lights at W made us feel like we were living in a club. Its a great hotel to stay with a group of friends where the dim lights even in the room set the party mood, but if you are looking at doing any serious work or reading, the lights in the room are inadequate! The only escape is the balcony that overlooks the Bosphorous, but the view depends on how your room is positioned! The washrooms are a little discomforting because not only is the sink and the bathroom disconnected, but the walls are far too thin! What offsets the negatives are the super comfortable bed, a dock for the ipod, a functional gym, the extremely hospitable and friendly staff and the tasty Turkish Delights that were found on the bed at night! W is nice, but not as nice as we wanted our hotel to be during a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityNewYorker
Reviews.Content: The W Istanbul was one of the highlights of our stays throughout Turkey. The rooms were stylish, comfortable (especially the beds), clean, and the showers were like having a spa in one's room because of the great water pressure and shower head size. The service was impeccable - all of the staff members we encountered were professional, warm, flexible, and very helpful in planning daily trips, making reservations, etc., especially the staff who assisted with handling luggage. Food and drinks at the hotel were also excellent. Little touches like complimentary strawberry mint tea in the afternoon and coffee in the morning were great too. Only drawback is the distance to the tram/train for sightseeing (the hotel should try to organize shuttle rides to the tram) but we really liked the Besiktas neighborhood because it was a nice quiet break from the packed streets and frenetic pace of sightseeing during the day in the Old District and it was nearby to many of the popular restaurants and bars we wanted to try.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Middle_East_Explorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights and paid an average of about $300 per night, including all taxes and one hour of internet access per day. In many ways, the hotel didn't meet my expectations. First, my room was very small, not at all how the "typical" room appeared on the website. Next, as others have commented, the noise from the hallways was very audible in the room. The toilet and shower were separate, which is fine, but the shower was much smaller than the website implied and it reminded me of a "prefabricated" unit. The sink and vanity area were right out in the bedroom, which would not afford the right amount of privacy if more than one person occupied the room. The bed, while it would have been comfortable for most people, was way too soft for me, and when I inquired about getting a harder bed, I was told that all the beds were the same. It's OK to have a "signature bed," but there should be some variety to accommodate different guest preferences. Finally, I thought the service in the bar was very slow and the waiter mixed up the order. Given its "high-tech" marketing, I expected internet access to be free, and it was about $10 per hour in the room. I actually liked the location, which was near the water and within walking distance of Dolmabahce Palace. The street on which the hotel is located is a quiet, pleasant, renovated street with upscale shops and restaurants. Parallel to that street are two nearby streets with more affordable shops and restaurants, including all of the major international chains. The concierge was also very helpful. But overall, if I went to Istanbul again, I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish yet practical with brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: Stevie390
Reviews.Content: I had been nervous of staying at a W Hotel in the past, as I thought that it may be a bit too trendy or hip, or have too much style over substance, for my more modest tastes. Happily, whilst it does undoubtedly have a degree of high-maintenance clutter, the W Hotel in Istanbul nevertheless offers a high quality and enjoyable accommodation experience. The hotel is located in the Besiktas neighbourhood, close to the waterfront. It is clearly an up-and-coming area with several designer stores starting to open in the adjoining street. It is a little way from the heart of the centre, but taxis are readily available or itâ€™s a 15-minute walk to Kabatas where the funicular provides access to Taksim Square or the tram heads to Sultanahmet. It was more convenient than I had feared. The â€œwonderfulâ€� room was impressively styled in burgundy and dark wood with a pleasant selection of mood lighting effects including a usefully bright â€˜workâ€™ mode. The beds were lovely and there was a large desk, wall-mounted tv with English-language channels, safe, full range of Bliss toiletries in the snazzy bathroom and a well-stocked but pricey mini-bar and tempting â€œmunchiesâ€� tray. There was a lot of superfluous items and some of the room elements were confusing to operate, but overall it was a very comfortable room. The only thing I missed was tea/coffee facilities and complimentary water would have been a nice touch given the room rates. Wireless internet was 10 lire per hour or 30 lire for 24 hours, or it was available for free in the lounge/lobby. Breakfast was comprehensive and very tasty and a room service dinner was also very good. The hotelâ€™s public areas were comfortable and surprisingly calm â€“ I had feared having to walk through a discotheque all the time! I also have to say that the staff were all very pleasant, well-trained and extremely helpful and really made me feel a valued guest. So often, staff in these type of boutique establishments can be overly â€˜coolâ€™ or aloof, but not here. Overall, then, the W Hotel is a luxurious establishment with dazzling design and style, yet also comfortable and welcoming â€“ and therefore mostly justifies its expensive price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance?”
Reviews.Author: ibbythegreat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the W istanbul for one night and we were very dissapointed with the hotel. We were originally meant to stay for 3 nights but we changed this to the park hyatt istanbul and decided to only stay in the W for one night. The interior of the hotel is stylish but the rooms are not functional at all. We stayed in a spectacular room with a garden terrace. Having read other reviews on this hotel I have to agree with what other people say. 1. The walls are thin and you can hear people walking past, closing doors, tvs etc 2. We could here the toilet or drainage from other rooms. 3. We had a stained bed sheet but only noticed it in the morning!(old stains) 4. Everytime you have a shower a lot of water spills onto the floor. 5. The air conditioning is diffucult to use I did mention these points to the manager who did seemed concerned and offered us another room. However I think the hotel is deeply flawed and considering hotels such as the four seasons, park hyatt are so close by I would strongly advise people to try these hotels. The only positives I can draw from the hotel is the service and staff were good and the bed is very comfortable. The W managment need to address these problems as many of the other reviewers have repeated them over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: basselkardan
Reviews.Content: it was really the best hotel ever....everything was great..rooms, location, staff, specially the concierge it was sooooooo helpful. i highly recommend it for everyone

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but some issues.”
Reviews.Author: Braindrain
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. I did email the hotel that I was going to have an early arrival. Turns out, my plane arrived far earlier than planned and I got to the hotel around 7 am. Unfortunately, they did not have a room ready so they stored our luggage for us and we went out around the Sultahmet area for sightseeing. The room was ready when we returned in the late afternoon. I should mention that I used Backpackers Travel Agency (through the Turkey Travel Planner website) to book my airport transfer to/from the airport. It was far cheaper than other options and I didn't have to look forward to haggling/arguing with the taxi driver. The service was prompt and friendly, even though the drivers didn't speak much English. The hotel located at the corner of 2 streets and was very modern and funky. As a SPG Platinum, I received an upgrade to a suite. The suite isn't what I'm used to in regards to separate sitting and sleeping areas, but it certainly seems larger than many of the rooms mentioned from other travellers. The room was in a rectangle shape with a small chair/table in the corner. There was a fairly good sized working desk with a DVD player hidden in one of the drawers. There was a double sink in the bathroom and the shower/toilet are in separate and enclosed stalls.
