I must say that shower stall felt spartan although it was surrounded by marble/granite with horizontal stripes. It kind of made me think that was how "institutional" showers might feel. The shower controls were "Japan-style" with separate knobs for temperature control. The toilet was a strange rectangle shaped unit with a "cleaner" (think Japan, again) sticking out. Unlike Japan, that thing stuck out all the time and a little too much. Let's say I was surprised a few times when I leaned back just a little. There was a small outdoor patio with 2 chairs and there was a skylight in the room that could be opened. The HVAC in the room is extremely difficult to operate. I would think I had it sorted but there wasn't any A/C to be felt. Even to this day, I'm not sure if I knew how to use it correctly or whether the A/C just wasn't up to snuff. The TV was built into the wall that separate the bathroom. Problem is, there was quite a reflection/glare off the wall so it was really hard to see. In addition, there didn't seem to be any external speakers so I had to turn up the volume to maximum settings most of the time. There is a separate Bose soundwave system on the night table.The telephone was the Cisco touch-screen kind and I found it useful that I could get weather on that thing. For internet, you have to sign up online but use a function on the phone to get your special code to enter. First time I've seen that set-up. The light controls on the wall were pretty funky and had different lighting "moods". I should mention that the elevators use a touch system and I had to "learn" how to press it from my room floor. In terms of noise, it seems I had it lucky and heard nothing from neighbours or the hallway even though my room was closest to the elevators. One night, I did hear sound from the nightclub although my room was on the highest floor. Let's just say this was extremely annoying. For taxis, it seemed taxis from the hotel were ok and used the meters. It should be around 15TL to get to the Blue Mosque area. However, other taxis in the city weren't as honest. We would usually take a taxi to Sultahmet in the morning but take the metro to Kabatas - the closest stop to the hotel. From Kabatas, it's a dog's breakfast with taxis. One time, some taxi tried to tell me there was construction and he'd need to take a circuitous route - all to the tune of 20TL. We got out of that taxi right away. It seems negotiating down to 5TL was generally accepted for the Kabatas-hotel run. You can walk to the hotel from Kabatas but the traffic pollution is horrendous. We did it one day and vowed never to do it again. From Taksim to the hotel, it should be about 7TL on the meter. Let's just say most taxi drivers don't speak English (not that I expect them to) so it'd be wise to learn numbers and have your address written down for them. Around the hotel area, just behind the hotel on the right is Cafe Nero. We found it after the 2nd day and it was a god-send for good Italian coffee and paninis. There are some restos if you walk further and we tried an Italian place but it was awful. Behind the hotel on the left, you'll encounter a supermarket. Walk down the street where the supermarket is and you'll encounter a ton of local restos. We ate here most of the time. Prices were generally reasonable but quality varied a lot. For service, it was generally superb. We did talk to most of the front staff people and they were very helpful. We didn't use the concierge. However, I did have one problem trying to get body wash. The body wash wasn't replenished after cleaning so we had to phone down on the last day to get a bottle. It took 3 calls and about 45 min. After the first 2 calls, someone finally got to my room. However, he messed up by getting shampoo first, then conditioner. I finally gave him the bottle that I wanted replaced and never heard from him again. That necessitated the 3rd call in which he finally returned and got it right. Would I return? Probably as I don't want to stay in the Sultahmet area. If the metro actually extended as far as the hotel, it'd be a definite yes. However, generally speaking, the hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Super Trendy Istanbul....Bathrooms not functional”
Reviews.Author: viajero26
Reviews.Content: The W Istanbul is a very trendy and luxurious hotel. I tayed here with my family over Spring break, we had two connecting rooms "Wonderful Rooms". The only complain I have about the rooms are the bathrooms, the bathrooms are "open". There is no separate room to shower in, the shower is apart of the bathroom. And neither is there a real divider between the bathroom and the bedroom. Thats fine if your sharing a room with a boyfriend or girlfriend, or a friend, but not when your sharing it with a sibling. Because my sister and I had to take turns, one of us would go on the other side and hang out for a few min while the other was getting in the shower or changing The hotel is located about 10 min away from all the major attractions ( if there is no traffic ), but its kind of nice to be away from all the hustle and bustle of the Sultanahmet. Don't go to the hotel restaurant for breakfast, it is overpriced and not very good. Overall I highly recommend this hotel, great beds, and very trendy, just make sure you ask for a room without a "open" bathroom, unless you are fine with that.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: PolarBear33
Reviews.Content: First off, the rooms are loud. The walls are made of paper and you can hear every detail of your neighbor's life. In addition, if you're staying close to the elevators, you can hear and feel vibrations from the music playing in the lounge space at night. Between the two, my wife and I got little sleep during our stay. It didn't help that the shower and sink are in the room rather than in a separate bathroom. If someone needs to use the bathroom in the middle of the night, it's hard not to disturb the other. Likewise, the shower is loud (both the shower in your room as well as your neighbor's) and steams up the whole space. It's a flaw in the room design. Another flaw is that the cabanas that come with many of the rooms are not covered, which limits their usefulness for those who like a little shade. Service was also spotty. The hotel sent an email days before my stay asking if there was anything they could do for me in advance of my arrival. My response was apparently ignored. When we arrived, we were told that we were getting a triple upgrade, but the room we ended up getting was exactly what we expected. Either we were originally going to get a worse room than we paid for or the front desk lied. Also, the concierge staff was a little like Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde. One of the concierges was very friendly and genuinely helpful (I believe his name was Jed). The other concierge was a little on the surly side and made two horrible itinerary/restaurant suggestions to us. At least the rooms were clean and relatively new. But that's not an excuse not to provide slippers.

Reviews.Title: “Good for your senses - bad for your sleep”
Reviews.Author: Traveller01Berlin
Reviews.Content: Stylish Hotel, great location - poor acoustic insulation. You hear EVERY word people speak in the corridors and if you have a room with a connecting door you can follow the television program of your neighbor - and other things that discretion would deem private. Unless this is not taken care of I would not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place but no consistency”
Reviews.Author: lupe92129
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel in Istanbul 4 nights in May 2010, we enjoyed our stay, few items I have to mention â€¦during our stayed the staff was very friendly and courteous, but there is no consistency in the servicesâ€¦we didnâ€™t get a newspaper every morning as promised, they missed the first night turn down services, then sometimes we got chocolates the others we didnâ€™t, 2 nights we got mats next to our bed the other 2 didnâ€™t. We didnâ€™t get body wash, just shampoo and conditioner for 2 days and then the last 2 days we got body wash, few days we got face towels, 2 we didnâ€™t. The location and the style is great, they just need to be consistent in their services.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Turkey”
Reviews.Author: rogi8
Reviews.Content: The W Istanbul is typical W, meaning the lobby is always dark with neon lights etc. We had decided to stay here because we could use cash and points and got a good deal. We were upgraded to a room with a garden on the first floor which was good bc we were close to the free internet in the lobby and was quiet bc it was on the inside, and since the bars and terrace were empty noise wasn't an issue, although doors slamming in the hallway did wake me up. The room is very trendy, not in a bad way, but the toilet is in a closet, the shower is also anothe closet and you can even close the doors to the sink area. Overall, good size and no complaints. The concierge is very helpful with restaurants, and gave us good advice on touring. The one comment is that since it is new make sure to take the address with you bc taxi drivers don't know where it is, they should have something to give you as you get in a taxi, and bc of where it is located the taxis take a long route to go anywhere. My only real complaint is that we are spg gold and this is the first spg property where they don't have water for you each day in the room. We also weren't paying full price and if prices are similar to the Four Seasons it isn't even a question, choose the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “As expected from a W....”
Reviews.Author: KIMBO777
Reviews.Content: Overall, an excellent experience, as to be expected from a W. I left the reservation to too late and found out 3 days before the trip that F1 was on a week earlier than usual. Fortunately, I was able to book 3 (out of 4) nights and then go on waitlist for the final night. On the day of arrival, a cancellation came up and I was able to extend. I stayed in 456 (a Mega Room) - spacious and chic. Not the most classy but very fashionable, again as expected from W. Great services generally. Concierge in particular was very helpful and knowledgeable - he appeared to be the busiest man in Turkey but always managed to give us excellent advice on sight seeing, dining etc. On check-in, missing a few things like laundry bag, slippers etc but soon fixed upon request. Nothing is complimentary, however. There were bottles of water in very strategic locations with neat little tags - not saying "with our compliments", as usual with many hotels but "we will charge you".... Not a big deal for me - decent mart around the corner so stocked up on bottled water. Location is not best for sight seeing around Sultanahmet area given need for 20-40 minutes taxi ride, depending on traffic but the neighbourhood was ideal for us. We had deliberately decided against Sultanahmet Four Seasons and chose W because we wanted somewhere a little quieter and less touristy. Great little fashion boutiques all around the hotel. Bar/lounge very nice. W Kitchen also very good. Out door dining got a bit dusty from traffic but still enjoyable in the great weather. Airport pick up was pricey at EUR95 + tax but the BMW 7 series was comfortable and the driver was professional and courteous - certainly a lot more comfortable than a taxi after a flight. Overall - highly recommended. My usual hotels are 4-5 star business hotels given most of my trips are for business. It was very refreshing to stay at the W for a change.... Many thanks to all the staff at SPG and W Istanbul for making our first trip to Istanbul so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with the W hotel in Istanbul...”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchnick
Reviews.Content: The staff is one of the main things that makes this hotel so amazing. They are kind, authentic and go the extra mile to make your stay pleasurable. As a short sidenote, I left something behind at the hotel and they were so kind to send it to me via courier the next day. When you travel about the city to the cultural hotspots, you'll have to take a taxi because the hotel is about 20 mins away from the major cultural sites (Blue Mosque, Sultanahmet area, Topkapi palace, etc.) I learned very quickly that the best thing to do is to restrict yourself to taking one of the taxis waiting outside of the hotel because they are considered safer and won't rip you off in the manner that the other taxi drivers do. Apart from the downside that the hotel is a bit far from the major tourist sites, the hotel is in a great recently renovated neighborhood with plenty of nice little restaurants located on the same street as the hotel. The hotel is expensive, but worth every penny of your money.

Reviews.Title: “Terminally chic”
Reviews.Author: Marleneb
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks conventional on the outside, but inside it's dark with strange lighting and odd touches everywhere. The staff is very helpful and friendly, expecially the concierge staff. Watch out if you get a connecting room, noise from the next room can be disturbing. We should have asked to be switched after the first night (we stayed four nights). The location in an upscale shopping area is nice if you're there for shopping. It's not on the Bosporus, has no good views and is far from the old city sights. Traffic is heavy in Istanbul and it takes a while to get places. We took trams, but it's a bit of a walk from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “An urban Oasis”
Reviews.Author: deepika_ganeshan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Istanbul for 2 nights - and WoW what a hotel! So typically W - loved the lounge - where we sat out on the terrace under the night sky in Istanbul surrounded by chic Istanbulites. Definitely worth it - go ahead and treat yourself to a bit of luxury

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, dark, garishly decorated hotel -- but attentive service and good food.”
Reviews.Author: Maven-at-large
Reviews.Content: A very 'in' spot. Decorated, however, with the apparent intention of saying "look how different I can be from everywhere else." If you're looking for a hotel that is decorated elegantly and clasically, this is NOT it. It's dark in the lobby. It's dark in the halls. It's dark in the restaurants and bars, and it's dark in the rooms. In the room the lighting controls are mystifying and mostly illogical -- and there's not enough light to read or put on makeup. Some reviewer we read somewhere described it as looking loke a bordello. That's a good description. Lots of red. Expensive decorations. The shower is in a closet with a gasket that keeps the water in the closet/shower during the shower. The shower's controls need explanation -- but none was provided. When one's shower is over and one opens the shower/closet door water spills all over the floor -- luckily it's a stone floor there, so except for you having to deal with a puddle, that's not a problem. Luckily there's a plentiful supply of towels and bath mats. The room decoration is expensive, but strange. Clearly the 'like-nowhere-else' concept has been carried forward here too. The bed is super comfortable. Service -- particularly in the restaurants -- is about as attentive as any anywhere. The restaurant food is delicious, well presented, and ample. The hotel was apparently constructed from a series of buildings on a city block that were gutted and re-formed into a hotel. There's a center corridor between the rooms on the left and right that's also dark with strange red neon strip-lights one after the other down the hall. The hall itself is very long, so if your room is at/near the end of the hotel away from the lobby it's a LONG walk to and from the elevator every time you go between the room and the lobby. The hotel is not convenient to any tourist sites. It'll be a taxi ride to almost anywhere. Luckily, taxis in Istasnbul are cheap and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic W”
Reviews.Author: Wendelfarb
Reviews.Content: I agree with the reviewers who comment about the design - it is very cool. The room had a neat built-in "cabin" shower and toilet. The hotel was pretty new when I was there, giving it a particularly clean, crisp feel. It is true that the hotel is dark and trendy, but this is he brand image of Ws. It's not for everyone; Starwood's Westin brand is probably preferable for a slightly older crowd. The hotel is, admittedly, also a bit out of the main tourist areas, but is in a pleasant, quiet neighborhood. We ate at one the Asian-fusion restaurant and it was tasty, although quite loud from the club/bar below. The concierge, Chem (pronounced close to Jim, but I'm spelling it wrong), was very helpful in making restaurant reservations and other suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and being W”
Reviews.Author: jkofman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W while marooned in Istanbul during the volcanic ash incident in April. Like other W's around the world, this is one scores well on service, style and tech. Staff were very accomodating for us stranded travellers. This is not a great business hotel as the rooms are bit dark and hard to work in. And there is not a quiet team-based working area that I saw. However, if one's work can be done in the hip bar/cafe or lounging in the comfy rooms then you're all set. Location is great. Gym is OK. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: prescriptiondog
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great week at the W in Istanbul. The hotel easily lives up to its reputation of being the new hotspot in town. At the same time it provides you with a welcome home feeling after a long day out in the busy bustling city. The staff are awesome, very friendly and always helpful. The rooms are great and let you relax with help of amazing beds and luxurious rainshowers. The restaurant serves great food and the breakfast does not offer anything you wouldnt wish for. Keep in mind though that the hotel at some nights of the week does hold some of the best parties in town! Downsides? Cant think of any... only that I will have to come back sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ctobriens
Reviews.Content: We loved the W Hotel in Istanbul. First, I'd like to clarify some of the comments made on this website. The hotel may be considered "trendy" or 'hip" but isn't nearly as dark and "far out" as some of the comments made it seem. The pictures on the site also make the rooms seem overly dark. We found the rooms to be quite comfortable and had plenty of light. Secondly, I would recommend this hotel for families with kids. The staff was wonderful and the location is in a great area to wander around. The restaurant was good, although it was a bit pricey (and I generally don't get sticker shock). We found the restaurant, Pastarito, which is about 3 doors away to be great Italian and a better value. The area is nice. We could walk to the Bosphorous (5 minutes away), we were close to one of the palaces, and only about 15-30 minutes (depending on traffic) to the Blue Mosque area.

Reviews.Title: “modern, hip but very dark...”
Reviews.Author: aidalepara
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was great, the bars are very good and not empty as in most hotels. I would only recommend a few lighter colors here and there as one gets a feeling one is in a tunnel or an underground. Definitely more for younger people.

Reviews.Title: “You will either love or hate this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartinSurrey
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, close to everything. Hotel is very new and this shows - it's difficult to find your way around and the signs are sadly lacking. The lobby is shrouded in darkness and very trendy - rather like a nightclub. Service was OK, if not remarkable. I wouldn't stay here again but I think some people will love it. If you're going to book check their site carefully and see if it's your style - there are loads of deluxe hotels in Istanbul to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “A hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gunner7
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night for my birthday weekend and were checked in to an upgraded room with an outdoor cabana. The hotel had also organised a really amazing birthday cake and all the catering staff had signed a card. The hotel is very cool..... being in the lobby is like being in a club.... and the rooms are all done in dark wood and mood lighting. The bed was very comfortable, there was a flat screen tv and the bathroom had Bliss products. The location is good. Not near the tourist sights - which is a bonus - but on the corner of two streets so you literally have everything from a local supermarket to Marc Jacobs to the funkiest bars within a few minutes walk. Also nice is the Cafe Nero next door to the hotel if you need a coffee fix or you don't want to have breakfast in the hotel. The only negatives would be that the internet is expensive (but that seems to be the case for many big hotels around the world) and the hotel charged â‚¬6 for a bottle of water which to be honest is a rip off. That said, if you're after a hip place to stay, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: CorpBahrain
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at W hotel in istanbul. I must admit, it was one of my greatest experiences in any hotel ever. Right from my upgrade to a suite to departure, ther service was truly flawless. The cake on my birthday, the smiling helpful staff, the music, the concierge and of course the hotel itself, all wonderful! I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to istanbul and of course will stay there every time I visit that beautiful city. Thanks and congratulations, Hatim Dadabai

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could do better”
Reviews.Author: brunsky
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the W for five nights. The hotel is everything you'd expect from a W - trendy, chic, excellent service. The location is great, particularly for those with business in Levent. The rooms and the bed are great, the shower is superb. The food is yummy too. I would only fault it on the absence of sound proofing, particularly for the doors, which means you can wake up whenever people walk past in the corridor. Also the in-room products and services are really expensive - where even bottled water is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “for those who have been to istanbul before”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: THE HOTEL:If U know what the W chain stands for then you shouldnt be suprised that the hotel lobby is more like a trendy disco then a hotel lobby. It has a very cool interior design all throu-out the hotel. THE ROOM:I stayed in the so-called Mega Room (its a 4 point upgrade from the standard room). THe beds are really amazing. (i should know since Im a pilot and i spend over 2OO days a year in hotels around the world). Room has more then enough space. Internet is slow and the lighting in the room is very very dim. Its trendy thou. But if you want to pack....then do it when there is some sun outside becuase you will never be able to get that ammount of light in the room again. LOCATION wise its not very good. If you plan on touring the city then maybe this is not the hotel for you. SPA: its a bit of a turn down that there is no pool nor a sauna....nor a hamam for that matter. BREAKFAST: Medium buffet with a very good selection of main dishes to be ordered from the menu (which is included in the buffet-s price for 46 YTL) PRICE: We payed 145 EURO plus tax,plus breakfast All in all i would very very much recomend this hotel because its clean and relatively new.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: blingsohard
Reviews.Content: After hating the other hotel I had been staying at, I checked into the W Istanbul and loved it! Great gym and I actually loved the location-away from all the super touristy stuff but still in an area with plenty of shopping and things to do. The staff was very professional and my room was spotless. Very beautiful hotel! Whenever I needed to check my email they loaned me a lap top free of charge for me to use in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Glam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xoxx
Reviews.Content: Interesting renovation to a historic property. Attractive and helpful staff. Great buffet breakfast, Very comfortable and modern rooms. The lobby tries to hard to be hip. Very dark and too much of a nightclub vibe to the lobby and hallways. If this decorating scheme was changed, this place would be fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sakis031
Reviews.Content: well done guys...you doing an excellent job there. The hardware is amazing and the operation is outstanding. the music was one million dollar . Respect to the one who choose it.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaraAuckland
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel with incredibly friendly and helpful staff. The decor is amazing. The location is slightly less than ideal but other aspects of the hotel make up for this. Definitely recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ive been to”
Reviews.Author: HichamA
Reviews.Content: Newly constructed. Great service and great rooms with private patios to each room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, slightly inconveniant location”
Reviews.Author: SPUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, really beautiful rooms, food, bars. The staff are all really friendly and helpful and kind. Only downside is the location of the hotel is not great - you can't walk to any of the tourist sights from here, and its not close to the tram either. Be prepared for this if you stay...

Reviews.Title: “Night Club meets Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edfunder
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a tour of Turkey. Because we were unsatisfied, we left mid way. This left us to find to a hotel last minute. Unfortunately the Four Seasons Properties were not available for most of our stay, so we chose the W. I'm in my 20s and this property is a little too hip for me. We had a suite which was nice - Expect for the lack of lighting. The entire hotel has night club lighting. Dark and mysterious with music to match (heavy base). I've come to expect this from a W - but we were more comfortable staying with a brand we know. We are used to Four Seasons service which is top notch. The is one level below that. But not bad over all. W offers a "Whatever Whenever" Service. When you call its hard for them to understand english - so getting what you want can be a pain. The Front Desk and Concierge are fine with English. They do have a nice concierge who has a website www.istanbulling.com. Food is good but not cheap, but good for what you get. One plus is that W is about a 5 minute walk from The Four Seasons Bosphorus. While i did not stay at the hotel, i did use their Spa, which is one of the best I've been too. The restaurant is great as well. This hotel is not close to a majority of the sights. And traffic during the week is horrible. So it will take about 30 - 40 mins to get to Patriarch, Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, ect.

Reviews.Title: “funky and chic”
Reviews.Author: AnniePhilly
Reviews.Content: LOVED the outstanding breakfast included at Spice Market Restaurant ... concierge was truly helpful. Location is a bit off the beaten track for touristy attractions. Shower configuration is odd. Room very comfortable except for all the W goodies for sale, which made it cluttered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the W istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonDCTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the W Istanbul. What a fantastic hotel! The staff is beyond friendly, the decor is exquisite, and the room was simply marvelous. The hotel is in a great location away from the touristy area of Sultan Ahmet. Every morning, we walked to the Tram station, which is 15 mintues away, and took the tram to Sultan Ahmet. The Tram only costs a couple of Liras. There's a very nice Italian cafe next to the hotel called Nero. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great W - If you're into that sort of thing”
Reviews.Author: DucksOnParade
Reviews.Content: If you like the look and feel of W Hotels, this is a very nice one. For me, it is too over-the-top modern, at the expense of being comfortable. We had the standard room. It was nice and had many interesting, modern details. However, it didn't have a separate bathroom (the shower was behind a door that opened directly into the room and the sink area was hidden only by sliding closet doors). For the price, a separate bathroom would have been nice. Also, the hotel is very dimly lit. The restaurant and lounge/bar areas were very nice. The (free) breakfast was excellent - a modern take on the classic Turkish breakfast. The rooftop lounge was beautiful and a very relaxing place to sit and have a drink at the end of a day of sight-seeing. The staff and concierge were very helpful. It bugged me that the hotel had a metal detector at the door but pretty much just let you walk in and set it off without actually doing anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: floydio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Istanbul and were very impressed by several things: The helpful staff; my wife's bag was lost by the airline, and was not supposed to be delivered for 24hr+. W staff went to the airport and retrieved our bag before we went to bed! Awesome. The rooms; beautiful, very luxurious. The beds; oh my god, the most comfortable anywhere in Europe. The location is adequate, it is a bit of a jaunt to all tourist sites, but close to the Bosphorous. The halls are lit with purple neon lights framing the hall, a bit over the top. The concierge recommended a few places for dinner where he set up reservations; however, coming from the W we were served many items we did not order and then were charged for them. I believe there may have been some kickbacks to the concierge! However, overall, we loved our stay here, it was a cool, trendy, friendly, and comfortable place. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Terrible Terrible -- Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Gurentai
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably terrible experience -- from check-in, to the room, to the service -- absolutely awful hotel. There is no view, small bathroom, no tub, internet did not work, concierge was not available, etc etc etc. Shockingly bad experience here. I have stayed in 5-star hotels from London to NY to Tokyo to Rio to the Maldives -- I would say this is about a 1-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Chic!!!”
Reviews.Author: jptChicago
Reviews.Content: Very nice W Hotel. Service was A+ regarding another comment on this board being far away from the sights, I would somewhat disagree. Just hop on the lite-rail which is a 10minute walk away and it takes you anywhere inon the European side that you would want to go OR walk up the hill into the fashion district. If you go to the Bazar, check out Havazulu restaurant, GREAT food and service!! Also, concierge gave us a sushi recomendation which was fanatastic and classy (Zulu). Overall, really liked the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings - but Generally Positive”
Reviews.Author: LMacleod
Reviews.Content: I generally love W hotels, so I had high hopes for the new W in Istanbul. As expected, the bed was incredible (always great in the Ws and Westins), the decor modern and edgy. The service was great - the concierge went out of his way to help us multiple times; the valets were fabulous at getting us taxis and making sure we were happy; the restaurant staff served us breakfast at 2pm when we showed up. There are lounges and bars and the terrace is amazing. There were issues, though, too. We stayed in a 'wonderful' room, which meant there was no bathroom, per se. It was more of a galley kitchen version of a bathroom. Great space optimization, but not ideal (from my perspective). There is only a shower and it's really hard to keep water from spilling out into the main area as you are getting out. Wifi was the equivalent of $25/day, which is just absurd. Especially when they will lend you a laptop for free in the lobby. The prices of the restaurant were pretty high as well (about $10 for a glass of orange juice - it's good... but $10??) The food was good, but nothing exceptional (in fairness, we didn't eat at Spice Market - one of our favorite restaurants in NYC; we just had the breakfast). Generally good, but perhaps trying to be a bit too hip for its own good. I'd stay there again if we got a good deal, but it's definitely not my favorite European city hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Absolutely Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: MiamiBeach1
Reviews.Content: we stayed at 2 hotels is Instanbul, bookended by a trip to Bodrum, and the W was the stellar choice. there are many beautiful hotels in Istanbul, but the staff at the W was knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. when we asked for a cool cocktail closeby, the concierge escorted us us the street to make sure we didn't get lost (it was a cozy nook with super-cool music).

Reviews.Title: “Far from all the sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: remy1rose
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing of course, it's the W Hotel! The rooms were beautiful, the service was excellent, and the neighborhood was swanky. If you do not mind being away from all the tourist spots then it is perfect for you, but not for us. You have to take a cab or a ferry every time you want to go see a sight. Be prepared for this. The only sight within walking distance is the Dolambache Palace. The reason that this is such a big deal is because if you get tired and want to take a break or a nap, it is a big hassle trying to get back to the hotel and the traffic is awful here. Also, the hotel is very expensive. A bottle of water from your room costs 15 TL which is like 12 US dollars. If I could do this all over again, I would have stayed in a lower end hotel to be closer to all the sightseeing then stay at this high end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Piments
Reviews.Content: W hotel is an amazing and cool experience. The staff is very good, always trying to help in any way. They even borrowed us a notebook with free internet access in the loby, for a quick email check. A simple thing that makes a lot of difference. The room is incredible - the lightning is excelent, the furniture very cool. The shower is excelent, specially in a hot country like Turkey. Another small nice thing - ipod docking. Nothing better then getting in your room and listen to the music you feel like. The breakfast is one of the best iÂ´ve ever had! Everything fresh and done at your will. And dont worry about the reviews that complain about location. A taxi to Taksim (restaurant area) costs about U$5. All taxi drivers knew where the hotel was. The hotel is 15 min walk to the Tram station, that drops you in all tourist atractions in the city. I deffinetly recomend this hotel to everyone who wants to spend a nice time in Istanbull in a fancy, cool and modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: JPandJen
Reviews.Content: We had such a great stay at the W. Fantastic hotel and great service (notably the friendly knowledgable bar manager and his ginger margheritas). Rooms are out of this world and the whole place is spotless. A bit further from the centre than we had hoped but a cheap cab ride or easy tram ride to the historic centre. Not too many restaurants nearby but their own Spice Market is even better than the New York equivalent. Try the "hidden" Italian at the bottom of the road as well. You'll be surprised when you get outside! I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMember
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the W in Istanbul. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was clean and comfortable. We were upgraded to a suit with an outside private terrace. I was only sorry we only had one night before our cruise left. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: 7travelnyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about 5 nights. It's a very nice hotel. Our room was very nice. The bed was very comfortable, good amenities, nice shower with great water pressure. THe staff at the hotel are all very helpful. THe breakfast was outstanding, they have plenty of variety at the buffet and the hot items were very yummy! We had dinner at the Spice Market one time and that was the biggest disappointment of our stay. The food was mediocre and our food took forever, I wouldn't recommend the restaurant for dinner. In terms of location, it's a little out of the way from the tourist area and old city so be prepared to take cabs. We didn't mind being a bit out of the way but if you're in Istanbul for a short period of time, I would probably recommend staying in the old part of town since that is where all the sights are. Overall, would definitely recommend the W.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable bed I ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: Sallyahb
Reviews.Content: The location is grate. You can Walk to Bosporus and the Dolmabahce Palace. The designer of this Hotel is probably afraid of the light. It is so dark inside, that when you come inside, you have to stay a while until your eye can see again. The rooms are very comfortable specially the beds. The most comfortable bed I ever slept in. So bad I had to wake up early in the morning. Breakfast was for a five star hotel to poor. Lunch, dinner and cocktails are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Take a torch!”
Reviews.Author: ngman
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - more a pleasure destination rather than business. Rooms are designed a bit like a posh bedsit - very nice, but trendy (and expensive). Beds are really comfortable! Only had breakfast at the hotel (TRL45) which was fine, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “very stylish”
Reviews.Author: wurstnase
Reviews.Content: Lovely, stylish hotel in central location in Besiktas, merely a couple of hundred yards away from the Bosporus. Phenomenal rooms - the pictures should speak for themselves. Pity I stayed only one night.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place”
Reviews.Author: ccnolan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W for 3 nights as part of a 2 week trip with my family. We absolutely loved it. We used points for our stay, and due to my husband's spg status, we were upgraded to a suite automatically. The room was huge and ultramodern, just as we like. The bathroom was incredibly spacious, with two sinks, and a turkish bath to shower in. Of course, the bed was so comfortable too! We also really liked the location of the hotel, despite Besiktas winning the Super League in football the day we arrived! The streets were packed with crazed fans, but we enjoyed the excitement. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the water, and a 15 minute walk to the tram that takes you to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Grand Bazaar, etc. The service was impeccable. The concierge gave us a great dinner recommendation, and the front desk was very responsive to any request that arose. Out of the 8 hotels we stayed in over our 2 week trip, this was probably the most comfortable and maybe my favorite! I would not recommend this hotel to the older or more traditional crowd. Though my parents were travelling with us, I suggested they stay at the Ritz nearby. When they came to see the hotel, the saw how we liked it, but they were turned off by the darkness, lounge music, and modern amenities. You should know that this place fits the "W" style, which is not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: M108
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W in Istanbul, as we have stayed at many Ws and had great experiences at all of them. W Istanbul did not let us down. It is an exciting hotel, attractive, really great staff that goes the distance to make sure you are comfortable and feel welcome. There was one kink to the room, but I can tell you never have I been so impressed at the lengths the management went to make things right. If you want a glamorous hotel in a great area with staff that really care about your stay, pick the W Istanbul. I know we will again!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing Service + Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: TrueBlueMoo
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Istanbul and first stay at a W. Overall, my 3-night W. hotel stay was a major disappointment. The hotel featured 3.5 star service, masquerading in 5 star prices. The GOOD: - nice room, especially if you have a patio. - everything is new and clean. - very good bed. - excellent shower, but no bathtub. - service got better by 3rd day, as staff begin to recognize me, but it was well below par for first few days. The BAD: - Not good value: overpriced. - upon checking in at 9pm, I was told the concierge would not be on-duty till the next morning (till after 11am!). Totally unacceptable, as I was looking for recommendations on dining and night life, upon my arrival; and early morning advise for the next day. - Over 4 days at the hotel, I only saw the concierge at his station once. - despite being a Gold SPG member, it was a hassle to get a free room upgraded. The front desk clerk wasn't allowed to make a decision, and had to call the duty manager (who didn't seem to be at the hotel!, and finally get permission after I refused to back down). Don't expect to get your room upgraded for free (as some other posters have indicated). - the hotel was quite. I'd guess 1/3 full. Making the room upgrade teeth-pulling exercise even more annoying - its not like there weren't lots of empty rooms. OTHER COMMENTS: - The restaurant was better value, but like the rest of the hotel, its so dark that you can't even see what you're eating. If you are dining alone, the wait staff largely ignore you. - W does not give provide even a tiny bottle of complimentary drinking water. Thirsty? Pony up 9 TL for a tiniest of bottles. - no newspaper delivered in the morning. - lacking toiletries in the room (toothbrush, show cap, q-tips, etc). - W's web site has no option for arranging hotel pick-up from the airport. Guests have to fend for themselves. There is no estimate for how much a taxi would cost, or travel time. - W. Lack charm, and a soul. It left me feeling cold. I would have checked out of the hotel the first night, if I hadn't already booked and pre-paid on-line. ADDITIONAL COMMENTS to W: - For god sakes, hire some women at the hotel. With all your stern-faced male staff milling around the front dark entrance, it felt like I was about to mugged. - buy a couple of light bulbs for the hotel. - iPod dock is a nice touch, but it is a tight fit for an iPhone. The cradle needs to be updated to fit the newer iPods and iPhones.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at the W”
Reviews.Author: jetsetsansjet
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our trip to the W in Istanbul. We had a 'Spectacular' room with outdoor cabana - the cabana is a lovely feature but it was not really warm enough to sit outside during our stay in early May and probably only really of use in the peak summer months. If we were to visit in Winter, would stick to the cheaper 'Wonderful' rooms. Cons Breakfast is pretty average and expensive for the quality of the food. We only had one breakfast at the hotel and went out for remainder of our stay. There is no physical divide between the smoking and non-smoking sections in the restaurant but this is not unique to the W and seems to happen everywhere in Istanbul. Lack of sound proofing between rooms. Whilst the hotel is very quiet in terms of external traffic noise, there is a notable lack of sound proofing between the rooms. Not sure if this was exacerbated by the fact that our room had a connecting door to the room next door. Luckily we were not affected by this at night but it was quite annoying to be party to several noisy phone conversations next door in the mornings. Pros Excellent concierge service - probably the most impressive and friendly/honest service that have encountered in a hotel. Cem gave us some great tips about restaurants, sight-seeing and taxis. Good location for bars and restaurants (short taxi journey away in Taksim and Ortakoy). Besiktas is interesting for a wander and to try some street food/casual local places. Vogue was an excellent recommendation and only about 3 minutes walk away from the hotel. Whilst the hotel is not on the water, it is very close to the Bosphorus and the ferry stop of Besiktas and it is easy to get around to Sultanahmet etc. from here. Taxis were cheap and plentiful and I was glad not to staying in the more touristy Sultanahmet. Gym is a decent size for a hotel. Super comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OSU_Sux
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a Megalo Room, this room was absolutely amazing, the most sophisticated hotel room I have ever stayed in. It is located in the old officer's quarters near Dolmabahce in a new master development that includes high-end shops and residences. The only downside I would give is that it is an expensive hotel that extends beyond the room rate with a day's worth of internet access costing $50 and cocktails/dinner priced very expensively in what is already an over-priced city. That aside, the Concierge was fabulous and very helpful after we had an issue at a lousy local restaurant. We would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: c_paris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 3 night stay at the W in Istanbul. We had a great time. The people who work at that hotel are friendly and helpful - they really made our trip to Istanbul one to remember with great restaurant and bar recommendations. Our room (upgraded to spectacular) was spacious, and the bed was quite comfortable. Hotel's decor is great. Bar at night was a lively scene, although the music was a bit loud for my taste. The W was perfect for us, a young couple without any children.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vallyty
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at W Istanbul. Very efficient and friendly reception-staff. I was happy with the upgrade to a Fabulous room with modern design and a small terrace. Good breakfast-service in the restaurant. Level of service is lower at dinnertime and in W Lounge. Staff in W Lounge didnâ€™t show any interest in selling me something under my visit. W Hotel is a hip address in Istanbul, but not a very convenient location for exploring the city. Heavy traffic in Besiktas-area can make it difficult to return to the hotel in afternoon and early evening. Some of the taxi-drivers in Istanbul do overcharging, so be aware. I got tired of this disrespectful behaviour, and I will never visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “they got it right from the start”
Reviews.Author: LJexplorers
Reviews.Content: We were among the first guests at the hotel and it was great. The location isn't bad, but it's such a comfortable haven in the middle of Istanbul. Cem at the concierge desk picked out some great nightlife options for us. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Our W stay”
Reviews.Author: CBduuzend
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a stay at the W hotel and we loved it. Very nice staff and very service minded. The hotel looks great, a lot of attention to details and funky, loungy experience. A tad dark at first sight, but thats the W look. The hotel is located in Besiktas - 10 min taxi drive away from the old centre. The dolmebace palace is a 15mins stroll away where you can catch the modern tram going to old instanbul. The rooms are very nicely fit, but they are not sound proof - noices from next room are very loud especially in connecting rooms ! Very nice bar, but prices seem overcharged. All in all, a very nice place to stay. Not very suited for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: MsThomas
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay at W. This hotel is a bit out of the way if you want to visit the old part of Istanbul, although by day 3 we had cracked which ferry, tram etc to get us there and back fairly speedily. Loved the bed, so comfy and we had a wonderful dinner at The Spice Market [hotel restaurant]. Fantastic staff, very helpful and friendly, particulary the consierge. They knew it was my husband's birthday on our last evening and brought a cake to our room with candle and birthday card signed by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hip place but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Rubster
Reviews.Content: The W is a very hip place and the staff was just fantastic. We watched the moon rise one night from the bar on the second floor. The hippness of the rooms goes a tad too far in that it is difficult to figure out how to use some of the gadgets and I am a gadget person! But otherwise the room was very comfortable. My wife did a spa treatment. She said the massage and facial were good but that the manicure/pedicure was not so good. The same person did everything which tells you why. There is some shopping around the hotel which we didn't care about. The Dolmabahce palace is nearby but we found ourselves taking a lot of cabs. Not a deal breaker though. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Service, Service ...”
Reviews.Author: Indrajit
Reviews.Content: I personally dont like the "darkness" of the Ws. But, once you get used to the darkness, the W, Istanbul is a gem. The hotel is all about service - from the manager (who has personally come to see me everytime I have checked in), the receptionists, the porters everyone is service oriented. The conceirge manager is exceptionally good - you should meet him and he makes all your plans. The restaurant is good, but overpriced. You can get all the chain restaurants within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The best (quickest) way to get around the hotel (to city) is if you take a taxi to Besiktas and then take the funicular.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel just a tad out of town”
Reviews.Author: lastcallforboarding
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the "W" Istanbul in July 2008. It is a gorgeous old building that is very well restored. The staff are fantastic and look after your every whim. We had some taxi issues while in Istanbul (being taken for a ride in all senses). However, when someone from the hotel got us a cab, there were never any problems. Part of the problem is that the hotel is a good bit out of way (15 min walk from the tram terminal), and a relatively new hotel, so taxi drivers didn't have a clue where they were going. Other than the hotel being a bit off the beaten track, it is a treat to walk in to attentive staff, a great concierge and fabulous decor. I can't comment on the value, as we stayed on Starwood points. The rooms were a little dark, but that's all part of the "W" experience. The patio off the rooms with the couch were a real bonus as you could sit comfortably outside and take in the air.. (We were on the ground floor). Down the street, you could find local shops that sold typical Turkish fried pastries for breakfast, if you didn't feel like going to hotel restaurant. Overall an excellent hotel, just a little bit out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: LyleSF
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but praise for the W Istanbul. It's a beautiful hotel away from Sultanahmet tourism, but close enough to get there quickly and cheaply. Located in BeÅŸiktaÅŸ, just northeast of Taksim Square, it's near a large array of shopping, restaurants, and basic services, in addition to a ferry port. A cab ride to Sultanahmet will run about 10 YTL, or you can walk 10-15 mins to the KabataÅŸ tram stop. Their normal rates are higher than I would normally budget for, however we found an amazing rate on Expedia. The in-room internet and minibar charges were higher than I would normally care to pay, but there was free wifi in the lobby and lounge. There is also a supermarket just around the corner, where you can find cheaper beverages, and in my case, local chocolate. :) Aside from the cool factor expected from a W, the gem there is the service. I had an unfortunate encounter with a food bug picked up in Cairo that became apparent shortly after arriving in Istanbul. When my partner went to a nearby pharmacy in search of something to help with dehydration, the language barrier made it impossible to convey what was needed. Upon returning to the hotel, the concierge inquired about his success, or lack of, and without hesitation, walked with him back to the pharmacy and translated the necessary remedy. I was back on my feet and ready to explore the city within 24 hours, thanks only to his assistance. By the way, there is no more comfortable place to recover than a W bed. There was always an eagerness to help by all of the staff. After going through a metal detector at the door (common in all upscale hotels there) and a short security protocol when first arriving, the front door gentlemen always recognized us with a greeting of "Welcome back." Impressive. Istanbul is an amazing city with so much to experience. The W only made it that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Really Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: septemous
Reviews.Content: I am in the "Sip" lounge of the W Istanbul typing this. We are so happy with our stay - it is quite remarkable. The staff here is as excellent as any I could ask for. The Concierge Service is a fountain of useful information and charm, the front desk is out to please and every 'talent' member has a smile on their face. For the room - we received a nice discount via Hotels.com for a 4 night stay. Yes one might want to stay in a more traditional hotel - but why? Isn't what your really after is comfort, companionship and a place to call home? The "W" is a both launching pad and nest. It is a bit out of the bustle - so be prepared to Taxi in and out of 'town' for the sites and nightlife - but it is not so distant that it is difficult, nor are Taxis that pricey here - our average ride to/from the W is between 8 - 20 YTL (About $6-15) Depending on where we are. The Ferry is right down the hill and makes it easy to get to Sultanhamet and the Hagia Sophia. --- I'll put up photos when we sync our camera. The rooms are fun with great lighting and comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “The W Experience Was Wonderfull!”
Reviews.Author: m-afshari
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience in a W hotel and I have to say it was absolute great! I have stayed in other 5 star hotels (mainly in Dubai) but this was had a different taste, it was funky, cool and sexy! As said in other reviews the staff in this hotel are absolutely friendly and helpful. We had an early check-in and a late checkout! Upgraded our room which had a beautiful and big terrace! Rooms are big, spacey, clean but one thing which was missing was an electronic kettle? The in-room dining had fabulous tasty food! Although drinks are quite expensive all around the hotel. I do recommend the spice market restaurant had a great noodle there as it had been a while since the last time I had one. Location of the hotel is quite good (i.e TopKapi with a cab is around 10-20 mins away depending on the traffic). One thing which was disappointing for our room was that we could here the next room watching TV or speaking loud, I bet they could also here us! This might have been due to the fact that our room had a connecting door to the next room. Overall I do recommend the hotel, although it is a bit pricey but I got a great deal from Expedia! Enjoy your stay there as we did ours!

Reviews.Title: “The W Istanbul - Truly Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: London_ML
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderfull stay at the W Hotel in Istanbul! The hotel is beautifully decorated. Our room was really lovely and spacious with a very comfortable bed with the rain shower being the star attraction! The hotel bar is great and I believe its one of the hippest in Istanbul (and for good reason!) We didn't eat in the main restaurant but did order in some breakfast in our room which was pricey but delicious! But it was the staff that made our stay unforgettably - they couldn't be more helpful and friendly. The company motto of whatever whenever rings so true! I have to esepcially mention Cem, the concierge who was incredibly helpful and well informed. He planned and organised several enjoyable trips around the city! I highly recommend the W and hopefully will be able to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and amazng service”
Reviews.Author: dsbali
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W over New Years. Having stayed at W properties in NYC previously I kind of knew what to expect in terms of the W style. However, the W Istanbul exceeded all expectations and was I think superior in decor, ambiance and especially service to other W properties. Decor / Rooms: Very chic and beautiful in common areas. Rooms are equally well decorated (fitted with great tvs and ipod / docking stations etc). Larger than expected guest rooms and super comfortable beds / bedding. Lighting in rooms is amazing (little pink lights under mirrors add a unique touch). Location: In a very chic area (Nisantasi / Besiktas) - there are designer shops on the door step. A bit of a drive to the Sultanahmet area but it was nice being in such a great neighborhood which is not too touristy. Service: Amazing service from reception / door staff and especially concierge (best concierge we've come across!). Overall a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Neighbourhood surrounding area! Good service!”
Reviews.Author: 789Snow
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights on the first week in Jan 2009. Overall good expereience! Concierge service very helpful~ It's a new restructure area with a lot of new brand name shops surrounded. Very upscale! I like the building architecture. The weather in Istanbul always rain in the Winter with NO sunshine. With the general old type of buildings in Istanbul plus the raining weather, it's kind of grey in mood, however, the new hotel area help me to jump out the mood to feel some cheerful. Hotel surrounding area is convenient for needs. There's a supermarket near by the hotel. It's easy to grab some fruite and drink. There's also a lot of local Kebab restaurants down 1 or 2 streets (only take less then 5 mins). Also a second floor Internet place near by too, only 1 Turkish for an hour. The hotel staffs are nice. The only little thing is the hotel forgot about our "fruite plate" which included in our package. We need to remind them on the second day in order to get it. Other then that, it's very excellent expereience! I definiately would recommended to others!

Reviews.Title: “In Istanbul, W = WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: bucsonice
Reviews.Content: I am so happy that this hotel is getting the excellent reviews that it deserves! We just spent 5 wonderful nights at the W Istanbul, and the only bad thing about our stay was that we had to leave. I had been to Istanbul six months earlier on a work-related trip, and I enjoyed my time in the city so much that I wanted to return with my spouse. I booked using Starwood points and chose the W. It is one of the best choices I have ever made. We arrived very late on the evening of December 25, and the night manager greeted us. After over 24 hours of traveling, it was a wonderful welcome. We were upgraded to a studio suite (room 308) because of my Platinum status, and everything about the room was to our liking: + The bed was incredibly comfortable. + The different lighting settings added a great atmosphere to the room. + The rain shower was refreshing first thing in the morning or after a long day of exploring. + The towels were the largest and most absorbent we have ever used, and they always smelled so fresh. + The TV had a great picture and sound. The room was so big, though, that we had to turn it up if we wanted to hear it from bed. On top of all of this, EVERYONE we encountered at the W--from managers to the housekeeping personnel and everyone in between--treated us as though it were their personal mission to make our stay THE most enjoyable stay we had ever had. From what we could see, every guest was treated the same way. The concierge, Cem, deserves special mention. He was always ready to offer suggestions and make reservations whenever we asked. He should give lessons on how to be the perfect concierge. As for the location, it's not in the Old Town, but I think that's an advantage. The hotel is a 15-20 minute walk to the KabataÅŸ tram stop. From there, you can take a direct tram across the Golden Horn that makes stops steps from the Spice Bazaar, TopkapÄ± Palace, Hagia Sophia, The Blue Mosque, or the Grand Bazaar. Alternatively, if you want to take a taxi, the hotel will call a trusted company that it knows treats customers fairly. Taxis are a bargain in Istanbul as long as you get a trustworthy driver, and that's a guarantee from the W. Another transportation option is to take a ferry from BeÅŸiktaÅŸ pier (just across the main street from the W) across the Bosphorus to KadÄ±kÃ¶y on the Asian side to visit the market and eat at Ã‡iya SofrasÃ½. (This was an excellent recommendation from Cem.) From there, you can take another ferry to EminÃ¶nÃ¼, which is very close to a tram stop and the Spice Bazaar. The neighborhood itself is a great place to explore. In addition to all of the upscale shops in the immediate area, there are many shopping and dining options close by. As you exit the W, turn right and walk up the hill about 20m and you will find a Caffe Nero. Or turn right, walk up the hill, and you will find a Migros Supermarket. Turn right at Migros and there are at least a dozen kebap shops and other restaurants as well as bakeries. Almost everyone in this area is a local, so you will see a different side of Istanbul than you will in Taksim or the Old Town. For those of you who have never been to Turkey, you will never find a more friendly, hospitable group of people anywhere else in the world. Explore! The W Istanbul is everything a hotel should be, and more!

Reviews.Title: “I Write Because I Love Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: Subprime
Reviews.Content: In the middle of a six night stay at the W in Istanbul. Writing this in their lounge, because there is free wireless in here but not in our room - not clear to me why? The concierge, Cem Manglay, is off the charts. If there is any reason to pay up to stay at luxury hotel while traveling to a foreign country, it is for this service. Cem is very affable, very competent, and has enhanced our traveling experience. By far the best part of the hotel. It has they typical look and feel of W hotel (upscale, pervasive lounge music, dark lighting, modern/urban). I like the decor of the room. Although I could understand other poster's concerns of no formal separation between the bathroom and the sleeping area - I happen to like this as well (more than my girlfriend - go figure?) On the negative side, anything that are neighbor says or does we can hear. He pees, we are hearing it. He farted, I heard that too. And they have a baby, brutal. Also, we are in a non-smoking room, but our shower and toilet reek of cigarette smoke - it is really weird and it hasn't gone away. The lounge at the W is typical New York in every way. A beer that cost $2 in a store sells for $10; there is 2/10 market in the NYC as well. It took a half an hour for somebody to wait on us although the bar was half empty. If you are visiting Istanbul and drinking at the W, then shame on you. My only excuse was that it was my first night. The restaurant, The Spice Market, was a better experience but again you should be able to do better. Food quality, atmosphere, prices were on par with New York City - but there was nothing about the restaurant that distinguishes it from one of a hundred similar restaurants in New York City. Did I mention Cem, that guy [--] rocks! With respect to location. Definitely better than staying in Old Town. If you want to go to that part of the city, take the Tram.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous experience”
Reviews.Author: Nana_JP
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent three nights at the W while on a weekend visit to Istanbul. It is very modern and trendy with lots of neon lights and amazingly comfortable beds. The location was just fine with an easy taxi ride to and from the major sights and the tram that goes all the way to the Sultanahmet is only one block away. We took the opportunity to walk to several fun neighborhoods in the area to shop and eat. I highly recommend the Chocolate CafÃ© on the street to the right of the hotel entrance, back a block or two, for breakfast- especially if eggs and latte is your thing. Also the Nero Coffee Shop to the street on the left of the hotel entrance was a great place to get coffee and pastries from morning to night. The area around the hotel is big name shopping, so if Prada and Jimmy Chooâ€™s are of interest, you will be in heaven. For most of us it is great window shopping. While the ambience is certainly interesting, the very best part of the W is the staff. Every single person we met had a smile and friendly manner. Coming back in after a day of sightseeing really did feel like coming â€œhomeâ€� with all the greetings and requests for a summation of our dayâ€™s adventures. Iâ€™ve been to many friendly hotels, but the Istanbul W far surpasses anything Iâ€™ve experienced before. One suggestion for visitors; the concierge can arrange reservations to see the Mevlana Sufi Sema Ceremony (whirling dervishes). This is not a glitzy performance but a traditional sacred ceremony in which the mystical dance and spiritual music is presented in a very dignified manner. It was amazing and the highlight of our remarkable trip to Istanbul. One warning for visitors; the hotel staff will get your taxi and make sure the driver knows where you are going and the meter is running. Be careful coming back via taxi! On one trip back to the hotel the meter was running when we started (I always check) but when we arrived the driver had obviously done something to the meter and it had a line of characters on it instead of the fare. He charged us 40 YTL which was the most expensive taxi trip we had including to/from the airport. So watch out.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Cool!”
Reviews.Author: HopesandDreams
Reviews.Content: For the young at heart, as a typical W, this boutique hotel is dark and romantic. Super stylish and cool, with neon lights throughout, modern decor, and sensual aromas and music permeating the corridors. What the room lacks in size (average by European standards), it makes up with in unique amenities (DVD player, IPOD docking station, glass enclosed TV, 5 different levels of lighting to create any level of mood in the room). The rooms' layout is different in that there really is not a separation from the bedroom area and the shower/sink and toilet area. Therefore, when you walk out of the shower, (and it is a great overhead rain shower, but there is no tub), out of the toilet or wash at the sink, you are viewed in the bedroom, which does not allow for privacy for the modest guest. As stated before, the bedding is wonderful, but the minibar and services throughout the hotel are expensive. The staff is great, and knowledgeable and yes there are plenty of them. They were completeIy staffed when we left for an early morning flight at 4:30 in the morning! As first time visitors to Istanbul, we did not find the location off putting. (You have the best of both worlds - the location is in the upscale redeveloped area of the city, with high end designer stores lining the streets, but one street over is the "real" local flair where you have everyday life, retail and grocery stores and restaurants). We liked the location because we were able to escape the hustle and bustle of Istanbul, (AND YOU WILL BE CONSTANTLY HUSTLED) yet join it when we chose. Yes, the taxi driver had to ask for directions to the hotel from another driver upon our arrival, but we were able to use the local transportation, trams and buses with ease, once we were out and about. The hotel is not in Old Town, where the majority of the sites are located, but a 10-15 walk to the tram will get to there within another 10 minutes for a whopping 1.40 YTL! A Taxi cost about 10YTL, so it is a easy excursion either way. We enjoyed our stay at the W. It is contemporary and fun. If unique is what you seek, then this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: kaj2600
Reviews.Content: The W is still fairly new -- I believe it opened in May of this year. The hotel is VERY hip -- while we were there, there were two celebrity parties complete with papparazzi! Cab drivers, tour operators, and other hotel management seemed very impressed that we were staying at the W. By European standards, the rooms are spacious -- not huge, but spacious. But they are dark. The restaurant is VERY expensive and there are not a lot of places to eat nearby. The hotel is the flagship property in an urban renewal project. The hotel is very close to the soccer stadium and a blue collar neighborhood. It's also across the street from one of the sultan's palaces and the ferry to the Asian side of the country. This was my 3rd trip to Istanbul, so I was familiar with the various neighborhoods and how to reach them. If this were my first trip, I would have felt rather isoloated at the W. So I have to say the location is not really ideal for the first-time visitor (although one of the 4 seasons is down the road). the staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. one of the best aspects was the lounge area just off the main lobby. we utilized it each night to entertain friends traveling with us. For people who enjoy the W hotels (like we do) this was 100% a W.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous "W" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JKWBA
Reviews.Content: I had not stayed in the W Brand before. Had heard they were fabulous and the W in Istanbul is fantastic. Great rooms and public area's. My room even had a patio garden space. Lovely furnishings and amenities. Fantastic helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience, the W delivers...”
Reviews.Author: JakeDc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Istanbul. Staying at the new W Hotel was a destination within the destination. There is so much to talk about the hotel from its great location to the fine restaurant and bar to the unbelievable rooms...but really it's the staff that makes the experience special and unique. The staff was great, from the concierge, to the doormen to the bartenders, you always felt at home. However, I have to point out someone specifically by name, Elif (who I had read prior to the trip was fantastic through Tripadvisor) who really went above and beyond to make the trip truly memorable. Words can't describe really what an impact on the trip she made, you must go to the W Istanbul for someone who really does love her city, and loves helping her clients experience all that Istanbul has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “the coolest place in town”
Reviews.Author: whatsupnext
Reviews.Content: A super cool hotel! I spent 4 nights with a friend there and the staff went out of their way to make us comfortable and ensure we had everything we needed. Admit ally this is not a hotel for the conservative traveller who are looking for a â€œGrand Hotelâ€� atmosphere, it is dark with neon lights and club music in the corridors, cool and young. The rooms are not gigantically huge but well thought through. The bar on the hidden terrace is fun before going out; food was good and the cafÃ© also! When you visit a town for the first time it is vital how competent the concierge at a hotel is, well he absolutely managed to ensure we had a good time, saw the sights and a few hidden gems! Any time again!!

Reviews.Title: “W is for Wrong”
Reviews.Author: Pap
Reviews.Content: The first problem was getting to the hotel. The taxi driver at the airport didnâ€™t know where it was â€“ even given a map and the address from the hotel website he had to confer with two or three other drivers. We thought that this was maybe a â€œdumb driverâ€� situation but it happened on every taxi ride we took back to the hotel. In each case after the initial ride in from the airport, we gave the driver the card given to us by the concierge. In one case we ended up at Sulimaniye Mosque. The effect of this was that my wife became a virtual prisoner in the hotel, unwilling to go out on her own. We thought the room was very small for what it was advertised to be, even though we'd upgraded to the so-called "Spectacular" room . You cannot pull out the chair at the desk without it hitting the bed and then it blocks anyone else in the room from moving about. When room service brought our order, the waiter even asked â€œwhere do I put the trayâ€�; the trays were larger than the desk and we had to eat off the bed â€“ not quite as romantic as we would have hoped. The TV remote control would not operate the TV reliably from where I was lying on the bed so I called â€œWhatever/Wheneverâ€� and asked them to change the batteries. A technician duly arrived; he pointed the remote at the TV from about 60cm away and it worked so he left saying there was no need to change the batteries. From my position on the bed it still didnâ€™t work. I swapped the batteries with the ones from my travel flashlight and it worked fine. The technical answer to this is that effective power of a radiated beam reduces relative to the square of the distance the beam travels. At 3 metres from the television the received strength is 25 times less than at 60cm. The simple answer would have been to change the batteries as requested. I sure hope those few cents were worth saving. We went to the terrace bar but couldnâ€™t find anywhere to sit and were made to feel uncomfortable as we stood waiting. The layout of the bar is poor as there is no way you can fit 4 real people in the corner. The shower had a wonderful drench function. Unfortunately the door doesnâ€™t seal so lots of water leaks out into the floor leaving a gigantic puddle which we then had to mop up using all the towels. The hotel info guide states that we could order in-room dining from the Spice Market restaurant. When I called â€œWhatever/Wheneverâ€� for a menu for this I was told it wasnâ€™t possible. I found a partial menu from the Spice Market on the telephone and ordered what we wanted. My order was accepted and everything showed (except one item) although it took a very long while. There were loose electrical wires in the cabana. I mentioned this to the receptionist who said it would be taken care of. It wasnâ€™t. Overall, the stay was disappointing; to us it seemed like the entire philosophy is a triumph of style over substance. A Ferrari isnâ€™t much good if the engine misfires and the steering is wobbly.
